text: Boxed 355ml bottle shared between five at the 20th June 2017 monthly beer exchange in Chez Sophie. Really, really enjoyed this, thought it was lovely. Lightly tanned head on an almost black body. The nose was boozy and malty, as was the taste. Chocolate flavours combine with the booziness and as you relax into the beer: wish we had more to share, so easy to sip.

330ml bottle @ monthly tasting, Chez Sophie. Pours dark, thin beige head. Aroma has bourbon, earthy aroma. Taste is layered, complex, nutty malts, chocolate, bourbon influence, some vanilla, charred woody notes. Palate-coating. Excellent.

Good for style...not exceptional. 
Strong on aroma, but no other category.
Pours dark brown/black with little residual lacing. Taste is smooth chocolate with maple on the end.

On tap. Pours a deep brown with a small tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, bit dark fruit and dark chocolate. Taste of dark fruit, roasted malt and dark chocolate. Subtle bitterness and a dry finish. Full body, thick and flavorful with the slightest hint of bourbon. An easy sipper that goes down easy. Very enjoyable.

Good strong coffee/oak aroma with light sweetness. Flat black color with a small tan head. Taste is boozy with some coffee and oak; follows the aroma. Palate is smooth but a bit thin for such a big beer. Overall very good but I was expecting it to compete with the very best imperial stouts I have ever had and it falls short of that. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017   Parabola 2016. 13,1%. 
Czarny, nieprzejrzysty trunek. Kremowa, niewysoka piana. Delikatny lacing na szkle. 
Klasa sama w sobie. Kawa, duuużo kawy, świeże ziarna, minimalna paloność, czekolada deserowa, toffi, lukrecja.
Z drugiej strony sporo nut whisky, bourbonu, drewno, wanilia i ciasteczka kokosowe.
Bardzo ułożone, gładkie, wielowymiarowe.
Zbita, oleista tekstura. Alko zamiecione pod dywan. Piękne piwo. Mam jeszcze w domu kilka różnych roczników w butelce, na pewno wrócę i porównam;-))

duft:sød rund duft ristet chokolade ristet kant
smag: sød vanilje frugt karamel fyldig ristet malt

Fat på MBCC 2017. Doft av ek, toffee, chark, tobak, kolaremmar, bourbon. Stor och mäktig kropp, riktigt tjock. Klibbigt och härligt med toner av lönnsirap som legat på bourbonfat. Stor sötma som förväntat, men inte alls så det drar iväg. Ruskigt potent, växer till sig rejält i munnen. Helt klart en av dagens bästa IS.

12oz bottle. Black with a foamy brown head. Flavors are roasted cereals, licorice, chocolate, alcohol, resinous hops, bourbon, vanilla and molasses with herbal and fruity notes. Full body, soft to moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

355ml bottle pours black in color with a finger of light tan head that dissipates quickly leaving only a few spots of lacing on the glass. Aroma is light roasted grains and chocolate with loads of alcohol and whisky tones. Taste is dominated by alcohol and whiskey with a dark fruity and chocolate malty sweetness and a light roasted grain and hoppy bitterness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, this one suffers from being dominated by the alcohol and whiskey, lacks balance.

Bottle from beer junction seattle. Love the new 12 oz packaging. Tastes of moderately sticky brown sugar,figs and raisins. Nice vanilla and tacbacco notes that linger around on each sip. As with all parabolas that this one has nice subdued espresso coffee notes with a bit of heat on afrertaste. Love it.
Smells great, barrel, malt.. a hint on the sweet side.. very smooth for ABV. Tastes great.

Pitch black. Vintage 2014. Tiny,light brown head. Aroma is really complex raisins, vanilla sticks soaked in whiskey, dark fruits, some lightly coffee profile. Aroma is light to moderately boozy (it is quite noticeable). Still really nice aroma profile, moderately complex - lots of vanilla, coconut profile. Taste is moderately sweet - long, stable till the end of degustation. In general very good brew, complex, drinkable, there is some booziness here, but 14 ABV explains it.

355ml bottle. 2017 vintage. (14.5% ABV) Pours an opaque dark brown almost black with a small, short lived, tan head that leaves spotty lacing. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, tobacco, bourbon, dark chocolate, coffee, prunes, vanilla and oak. Sweet flavour of chocolate malt, roast, licorice, caramel, prunes, vanilla, coffee and oak with warming bourbon in a dry, mildly bitter finish. Full body with a thick, creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Awesome, lots of complexity. The high ABV is well hidden. A world class imperial stout.

Bottle; pours black with a ring of tan foam that quickly disappears; aroma of chocolate, molasses, bourbon, and hints of wood, vanilla, and tobacco; taste is a little bit sweet with chocolate, light roasted malt, molasses, and some faint vanilla and wood notes; finish is dry, very light bitter with bourbon and chocolate; another great beer from Firestone Walker

Bottled from trade. 2017 bottle 0,375


Pitch black color, short head. Aroma of chocolat, roasted malt, some bourbon. Rich taste of chocolat and malt, velvety and creamy texture. Wow!
On tap at Elizabeth Station Such a good stout. Chocolate, caramel and sweet roast flavors. Rich smooth feel. Huge ABV but disguised so well. Excellent

strong malt, oak, and chocolate aromas. pitch black in color with nice brown head. full body, silky mouthfeel. intense rich malt, chocolate, and bourbon flavors. faint notes of stone fruit and vanilla.

Aroma chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, wood, 
Appearance brown, tan foam, 
Taste medium sweetness, 
Palate medium body, full body, 
Overall a well balanced barrel aged stout. great chocolate flavor with just the right amount of barrel. I would suggest this beer to a friend.

Pours black with light brown head. A strong bourbon aroma and caramel malts and coffee. A strong dark fruit, prune, bourbon, caramel, and roasted malt taste. A lingering bourbon taste with dark fruits.

Sweeter than I imagined but very nice. Bourbon, oak and perhaps caramel flavors are right up front and powerful. 
Full bodied beer that lingers on the palate with a sweet finish.

Just a special beer -- dark in the glass, dense and milkshake-thick. Aromas of mostly chocolate, but also bourbon and roasted coffee beans and fireplace. Molasses. Vanilla and cookie. Maple syrup. So complex. Bright flavors, and a long, long finish.

12oz bottle. Black color with a tan head. Sweet bourbon roasted malt chocolate aroma. Sweet cherry alcohol rich chocolate flavor. Smooth heavy body. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650ml bottle from Elizabeth Station. Vintage 2014. Pours an almost black with a dark beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, burnt sugar, some roasted seeds, little bit oily. Taste is similar with chocolate, dark fruits and bourbon notes. Chocolate and bourbon aftertaste. Quite boozy stuff. Aftertaste is the best thing that this beer does have in my opinion as the burnt sugar doesnt almost present there.

The base for this beer reminds me the base of Bellwoods 3 Minutes to Midnight and Skeleton Key. Though the burnt sugar has less presence here as it is, probably, hidden by barrel aging process. As I am not a fan of such flavor I cant rate this beer higher. But if you are - you will like.

2015. Pitch black, smaller offwhite head. Aroma of soy, dark chocolate, roasted malt, oak, anise, candy. Sweet up front, booze extremely well hidden, anise, dark toffee, chocolate, roasted malt. Heavier body.

2017. I have a 2015 in fridge. For the 17 it pours black nice head. The palate is creamy and full body. The taste is choclTe malt. Hints of coffee vanilla and dark fruit. Nice bourbon sweet burn. With age in sure its aweso,e as well.

2013 bottle. Poured into a snifter. Warmed a bit for a while. Jet black with a thin tan head.Sweet boozy aromas. Flavor is rich malty and sweet with boozy oak, vanilla and bourbon. Oily texture. Notes of chocolate, coffee, prune and raisin. Herbal bitterness at the end with a long bittersweet finish with some burn.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2017 Bottle vintage 2016: 13.1%abv. Pours oily black, opaque, with foamy brown head, which trNsform itself to a ring around the glass. Aroma: roasted grain, malts, molasses, dried fruit esters, vanillin, oak, tobacco, wood, sherry-like bour on notes. Flavor is very similar to aroma: intense note of roasted grain, toasted toffee, dark chocolate, coffee, cacao nibs like malt flavors, supported with notes of tobacco, dried fruits esters vanillin, tobacco, oak, sherry-like bourbon alcohol warmth. Finish is dry. Body is thick, texture smooth, carbonation low. Big, complex imperial stout.

Thanks to jackl for this via trade. Opaque dark body with a lasting ring colored off white. Aromas of dark fruit, fig, oak, bourbon, smoke, tobacco, and caramel. Deep and rich in flavor. Not too bourbon forward. Solid.

On tap at CBBs Imperial Beer Event. Deep black with a very thick light beige head. Big sweet bourbon and chocolate aroma. The taste is molasses, chocolate and bourbon. Delicious but simpler in profile than expected.

Tap at Craft Beer Base. A near black pour, dark olive brown with beige head, good sticky lacing. Bourbon forward aroma, dark chocolate but occasional milk chocolate flourishes. Rich smooth flavour, dark almost burnt malt, chocolate, anise, big whiskey barrel note. So smooth and full in feel, very warming, low carbonation. I was able to down three glasses of this with no palate fatigue or shift in flavour. Exceptional.

Pours thick & sludgy; black with a brown head. Aromas of chocolate (dark & milk), surprisingly hot with booze behind the barrel notes, some dark fruits, and rich caramel malts. Initially very sweet with dark fruits & chocolates. Mid-palate shows off some licorice & booze before finishing with caramel, vanilla, charred oak, & espresso coffee notes. Warms up with more booze & smoky, bitter coffee. Full-bodied, no carb, super dry finish. What can I say? Its. So. Damn. GOOD! Couldnt stop sipping. Delicious but tastes as strong as the label states. Not overly boozy but the heat is evidently there.

Many thanks to Brian for this outstanding brew! Vintage 2016. Robe noire dans mon verre alors que le liquide que jy verrais affichait les teintes ambrées et rousses dun vieux Scotch. La mousse a beau être moyennement tenace, le liquide est à ce point superbe et noble que 5/5 est une note encore trop basse pour le visuel. Bourbon outrageusement chocolaté, chaud, malté, sirupeux, dense, riche, mielleux. Cest tout simplement superbe. Un chocolat mi-amer fourré au massepain arrosé dun alcool cuit. Jamais je ne ressens le goût de lalcool dans cette concoction parfaitement équilibrée, mais ses parfums de sicre vanillé sont précis et nets.un sucre résiduel dosé me colle aux lèvres alors que je ne note aicun arrière-goût précis, si ce nest quune incroyable sensation de bien-être. Une importante question perdure : comment peut-on arriver à produire une aussi grande bière en aussi grande quantité? Une bière massivement distribuée devant laquelle doivent sincliner bien des bières rares qui séchangent à gros prix.
Great paired with a cigar after dinner. Aroma sits long with the palate for a very very good beer

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017  Rami Rami is drinking a Parabola (2015) by Firestone Walker Brewing Company at Chmielarnia MarszałkowskaLyczek od P. Korcz - i kilka niuchow. Wystarczylo do wzwodu. Od cholery bombonierki, wanili, kokosa tez, na bardzo bogato Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 2016 bottle, thanks ciocanelu! Dark brown color with tan head. Aroma is coffee, vanilla, chocolate, tobacco. Taste is tobacco, chocolate, vanilla and oak sugars again, quite balanced though. Slightly warming finish. Velvety mouthfeel. Very good, but not totally over the top.

2016 aged at 33 degrees shortly after bottling. Pours dark as a starless night. One finger of head that quickly dissipates leaving no lacing. At 13.1% ABV, head characteristics are difficult to produce so an allowance shall be made and an outstanding score awarded.

World class complex nose of dark fruit (plum, raisin), bourbon, caramel, vanilla, molasses and subtle chocolate over a background of tobacco and oak. The nose is a rich mixture than blends exceptionally well then fades into the bold tobacco and charred oak background. 

Light full body that is substantial and almost achieves creamy. The high alcohol content produces a rich velvety smoothness that coats and flows across the tongue. Carbonation is light due to barrel aging, yet produces a noticeable effervescence in the middle and a slightly prickly finish. All things considered, the palate characteristics are quite outstanding.

The flavor profile is world class and quite worthy of this beers reputation. At first chocolate is light but gains in prominence through the experience. It never achieves dominance but lets its presence always be known - especially from about three quarters through. 

Bourbon is similar except that it peaks during the first quarter. In the middle lies the true richness of this beer. Dark fruits explode and then succumb to caramel and molasses bringing with it a solid sweetness as a contrast to the bold elements of this beer. These, in turn, fall to the bold tobacco and charred oak notes which are preceded slightly by a vanilla burst. The finish is a slow fade of blended flavor with tobacco, oak and vanilla lingering. Alcohol remains covered until a nice burn at the finish.

Poured a very dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted caramel malt, dark berry fruit and dark chocolate with some lit cigar. Full. creamy body, flavour of the aroma, some wooden notes in the background. Dry, bitter end.

Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Genialna, kokosowo-waniliowa beczka, niezwykle bogate i złożone, a zarazem bardzo klasyczne piwo. Zdecydowanie warto leżakować 2-3 lata.

On tap at Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is cherry liqueur, dark chocolate. Taste is boozy and sticky (but not cloying) sweet cherry / herbal liqueur. Almost creamy. Some herbal bitterness on the finish but very balanced and terribly drinkable for 14%. Reminded me of a Barleywine meets Imperial Stout.
On tap at Cannery Row Brewing Co. Oh wow, this this a beast, so smooth and no hint of the mega ABV, lots of dried fruit flavours, delicious and dangerous.

Muy compleja. No hay un predominio claro en el aroma de nada. Es una multitud de especias, madera, caramelos y torrefacto. Casi como un tabaco de pipa aromatizado. En la boca es muy dulce y larguísima. Melosa. De lo mejor que he probado nunca
2016. Very syrup wine aroma. Black in color with thin tan head. Chocolaty velvet with a prune backround. Very creamy and smooth.

Bottle care of Andrew Watson at the British Bourbin Society, AGM. Opaque black beer with tan head which dissipates to nothing. Nose is malty, coffee, liqueur, caramel, butterscotch. Taste is roasted malt, caramel, ripe fruit, wood aged, butterscotch. Yummy.
Bottle. Dark dark brown with ruby highlights and a milky beige head. Aroma of vanilla, roast, barrel, raisin, and cocoa. Tastes raisiny, sweet, bitter, boozy, and rich. Full bodied and super smooth.

Bottle shared. Black with dark beige head. Huge bourbon! Loads of vanilla, toffee, chocolate, coffee, light berries, some tropical fruits, light coffee, some bitter leaves. Sweet malts and town sugar. Very sweet and under medium bitter. Full bodied. Fucking good.
Bottle at tasting panel at Warszawski festiwal piwa. Aroma of roasty malt, chocolate, red and dark fruits. Taste is pretty sweet, very complex and balanced, lots of chocolate with vanilla.

Sample from The 5th Element presentation with Jeffers Richardson @ Akkurat, Sep 27. Aroma of prunes, syrup bread and port. Taste of dark chocolate, white pepper, red wine, brown sugar, liquorice, eucalyptus, vanilla, tobacco and alcohol. Not perfectly balanced as fresh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours dark black. Very boozy aroma that matches the taste and abv. Extremely thick. Raisin aftertaste. Tap.

On tap at Brewers Republic. Pitch black color, with a medium, bubbly, tan head and great lacing. The nose is bakers chocolate, smoky peat, light licorice, and butter toffee. Super sweet and sticky, with a light bitterness that balances quite well. Very heavy body, syrupy, sticky, and a little harsh, but in a was that bites and cuts through. This is an immense and boozy stout, with a sharp palate and pristine flavor.
Fat på CBC-2016. Smak och doft av vanilj, choklad, russin, marsipan, bourbon, fat med toner av tobak, Läkerol special och trä. Maffig, komplex, rund och len, stor sötma, bra balans. Mycket gott!

What a beer . Inky dark pour with a tan head that is small and dissipates quickly. Big chocolate aroma with coffee, alcohol phenol, and toffee. Brilliant flavor like a hopped candy bar. Vanilla, sticky toffee, chocolate with a big warming finish. Awesome.

appearance: viscous, inky black pour with a creamy tan head; syrupy legs.  aroma: amazing smell--full of chocolate, molasses, coffee, vanilla, some dark stewed fruits (plum & cherry), with raisin, pipe smoke, and a hint of leather.  taste: sweet molasses, bitter dark chocolate, smooth vanilla-bourbon notes, with roasty espresso, burnt wood, tobacco, leather, a hint of madeira.  finish: 	smooth, lingering sweetness, taste of bourbon (but no boozy heat), chocolate, vanilla, and molasses; chewy, slick, full palate. notes: 	Superlative impy stout. Absolutely cant believe the abv is 14. Big and rich and flavorful, but alcohol well-hidden. 2011 vintage, aged for five years and shared at Beerble Study with the boys. Well worth the wait. Wowser.

Coffee roasted malt aroma and flavor with a nice whiskey oaky finish. Dry finish. Well balanced. Nice whiskey oaky in the aroma. So full flavored and smooth. Slight boozy finish. Very tasty. Maybe slight bitter finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Easily my second favorite stout of all time behind Alesmiths Speedway Stout. Thick, chewy body that is the consistency and inky black color of used motor oil. Bourbon barrel character rounds out the rich dark chocolate, dark fruit, and burnt sugar flavors.

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2016 Vintage 2016. APARIENCIA: de color negro con algunos destellos marrones y rojizos a contraluz; corona de espuma color beige de baja retención, con burbujas compactas.

AROMA: licorosa y dulce con muchísimo carácter de la barrica; las notas a coco tostado y vainilla son dominantes, además de bourbon y muy ligeramente la madera. Notas a caramelo, toffee, cerezas negras, tabaco, muy ligeramente otros frutos oscuros como dátiles e higos caramelizados, además de chocolate dulce y café pero todo queda opacado por las características de la barrica.

SABOR: muy dulce de inicio, muy marcadas las notas a coco tostado y vainilla, en menor medida el bourbon, ligeramente la madera, caramelo, toffee, cerezas negras, algo de tabaco y cuero, pasado el trago continúan las notas características de la barrica, ligeramente algo de chocolate dulce, café, otros frutos oscuros como dátiles, higos, pasas pero muy ligeros, quedan totalmente opacados por el carácter que aporta la barrica; el retrogusto queda un amargor medio con notas dulces y bien presente las notas a coco tostado y bourbon.

SENSACIÓN: cuerpo medio alto con sensación untuosa en boca, baja carbonatación. El alcohol ligeramente presente en boca y en garganta al pasar el líquido sólo deja una sensación cálida no agresiva.

RESUMEN: una excelente cerveza, aunque el carácter de la barrica es predominante pero bien balanceado

CBC 2016 Blue session. Thick black body with a brown head. Aroma of bourbon, dark malt, roast, bitter chocolate. Taste of dark fruits, roast, sweet dark chocolate, mild boozy, pleasant sweet chocolate bourbon finish. Perfectly balanced, extremely nice!
Bottle and tap. Dark colour, aroma of chocolate, bourbon and tobacco. Taste is ful and sweet
On tap @ CBC-16. Very dark brown with a creamy tan head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, coffee, fruit and hops. Full body with a long bitter sweet finish.
Chocolate, brandy (grapy) and vanilla aromas dominate. Boozy and smoky. Sticky and syrupy texture lingers on the pallet. Lots of depth and complex but a bit too sweet for me.

UPDATED: OCT 20, 2016 Sampled from bottle at THT May. Black with light tan head. Big sweet roasted chocolate malts, coffee, toffee. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Full body, smooth, great.
Again courtesy of Maakun. Still agree. Bourbon violence. 20/10/2016

Draught at Hugh ONeills 5/16/16.Inky black body has dark mahogany tints on the edges suggesting there may be some clarity to it, but its difficult to determine. Tan head atop is large and slowly falls to cover.Oh boy. Did I just get served a pina colada?? Seems they could not have possibly got more pineapple coconut character in to this thing....Just all bourbon and oak with caramel/toffee, raisin and rich chocolate lingering behind it, somewhat menacingly. Its certainly intense...and the alcohol is pretty well concealed, I suppose.Wow, this is quite the beer....Rich, sweet, full of fruity raisin and milk chocolate but completely dominated by the rich coconut and pineapple character from the oak. At least theres plenty of sugar left behind to help soak it up, but that of course creates the problem of leaving a VERY sweet, sugary, syrupy beer. At 14% its pretty tough to have anything but that, I guess. Carbonation is low and engaging and helps to some degree, but this is still a monstrosity. Well if you like to be beaten over the head with intense flavors, this is probably your cup of syrup. To its credit the flavors are all clean and enjoyable.
Awesome stout! I love it. Barrel flavor is so complex, full body, silky smooth mouthfeel, oily texture, a bit boozy. Nice bourbon flavor, dark chocolate, coffee, sweet malt, caramel.

Sample @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2016 Blue session 20160513. Roasted malty and sweet with vanilla, bourbon, chocolate and coffee, full body with an oily texture. The finish is bitter and roasted with bourbon.

Fat på CBC-16. En riktigt bra IS. Fat, bourbon, tobak, vanilj, russin, kladdig chokladkaka. Tjock vätska, söt men med rejält motstånd från fat, välrostad malt. Tung, komplex, lager på lager av smaker. Löjlig gott.

Tap at DC Hama. Great nose with lots of cacao nibs, roasted coffee, toasted caramel. wood and light soy sauce. Average carbonation for the style with a rich and coating feel on the palate. The oak comes out more and the cacao just rides on through on the finish. The alcohol is almost non-existent. A world class beer. Would like to try in the bottle next.
Sample at CBC Blue Session. Black with no head. Roasted aroma with coffee, liquorice, chocolate with hints of soy, oak and whiskey. Nicely balanced and silky smooth.
sample at cbc. Pours black, no head. Aroma is roasted. Taste has a Rich maltiness. Balanced, smooth.

Backlog from Copenhagen Beer Celebration, Blue pass 2016-05-13 
Nice beer with a lot of chocolate and a nice barrel aging with some saltyness to it. Nice!

Tap at CBC. Pours very deep amber with thick tan head. Very nice and complex. Notes of oak, whiskey, caramel, roasted malt, chocolate. Excellently balanced and not boozy at all.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample @ CBC-16, Copenhagen 13/5-16. Roasted malty with chocolate, cocoa, vanilla and bourbon. The finish is roasted and bitter with chocolate, cacao and vanilla.

2014 bottle. Pours clear dark brown with a bubbly dark beige head. The nose has lots of dark brown fruits, vanilla barrel character and a meaty depth as well. Great nose. The taste has rounded flavours of cakebatter, rich prune juice or even px sherry. Chocolate and the tiniest vinous hint with mostly reminds me of a meaty, oak heavy red wine. The light roasted malts appear in the aftertaste along with coffee grounds and more bourbon goodness. Mouthfeel is a straight 5/5. The cellaring has paid off. Like it lots.

2015 at churchkey. Pours brown some head and lots of lacing. Nose is huge vanilla and molasses. Flavours of vanilla molasses bourbon, some chocolate. Taste big sweet medium bitter. Full silky body light carbonation.

pours with a thick brown head... great retention and lacing... 

Nose shows more wood than bourbon but with a good roasty background that carries a subtle sweetness reminiscent of dark dark chocolate.

Flavor is immediately drier than the nose made me believe.. bits of vanilla and sweet cigar wrapper envelope waves of great complexities.. a bit boozy with warmth.. and the malts open up to be a bit sweeter as the temperature rises.

Smooth but present carbonation with a pretty full decadent mouth coating body.

UPDATED: APR 22, 2017 2013 batch on draft.Pours inky black with a tan head. Smells of coffee with hints of oak and bourbon. Taste is coffee, chocolate, cherry, wood, caramel, with hints of vanilla and alcohol. Incredibly well balanced, you don?t feel its strength when drinking. Feels very silky and smooth on the way down. A great stout.

From bottle, 2010 vintage, so its about 6 years old. Black pour, tan head. This beer has all the bold bourbon, chocolate, roasted malt, and dark fruit aromas and flavors that could be hoped for. This beer is huge. Sweet. Rich. So good. Full mouthfeel. Its all that the hype has says it is. Deserving of its reputation.

Pours pitch black with a thin tan head and decent lacing. The aroma is bourbon barrel, toasted coconut, coffee, dark chocolate, and dark fruits. Taste is rich and complex with bourbon barrel leading the way. I definitely feel the alcohol and it stops just short of being boozy. I get rich, dark chocolate and even some coffee. The sweetness from the chocolate and bourbon is balanced by roast, licorice, and slight notes of ash and roast. Dark fruits like fig, raisin, and maybe some cherry linger in the background adding complexity. Mouth feel is thick without being chewy with light/medium carbonation. Maybe the best barrel aged imperial stout Ive ever had. Phenomenal.
Bottle shared at tasting. Dark caramel brown pour. Sweet boozy caramel aroma. Taste is really well balanced between sweet and booze. Really good.

2015 vintage. Big flavors and aromas of coffee and a ton of chocolate, mixed in with a smooth mouthfeel, oaky dryness, and a lot of hot booze. This is phenomenal stuff, although Id imagine another year or two would only help.
Barrels. Quite dry. Tasted side by side 2012 and 2013. Tasted at tims moby dicks share. Thx ibrew2or3 for the trade and tony b.
Very dark brown pour, small tan head. Fantastic maple syrup aroma. Flavor of Chocolate, bourbon, and maple syrup. Amazing.

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Vintage 2013. Aroma is roasted malt, booze, barrel, bourbon, coffee, chocolate, pretty good. Appearance is black, light brown head, poured relatively thin. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, barrel, booze, coffee, still quite hot. Mouthfeel is medium to heavy, medium carbonation, lots of sweet and roasted malt in the aftertaste. Overall, a little disappointing for the hype but still good.

(Bottled, 2011 vintage, 12.5%, thanks 50belair!) Very dark brown color, small brown head. Lots of tar, roasted malt, herbs and some licorice in the nose. Intensely malty flavor with ripe fruit, saltiness, roasted coffee, alcohol warmth and some sting from it, long aftertaste. Very full body, liquourish palate with low CO2. Slightly too roasty and whisky-like for my taste. A slow dessert sipper for whisky fans.
Mi primera aproximación a Firestone y hecho a lo grande. Parabola 2014 pasa a ser una de mis Imperial Stout preferidas. Se que a ratebeer no le gustará pero sobran las palabras.

Bottle. Pours pitch black with a thin creamy brown head. Aroma of bourbon, chocolate, molasses, vanilla and coffee. Flavor was complex and very balanced with bourbon, oak, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, caramel and molasses. Oily slick texture, full body, soft carbonation.

UPDATED: FEB 13, 2017 Bomber at home. Very dark, clear, brown pour with a medium height tan head. Tons of bourbon, toasted coconut, vanilla, burnt caramel, milk chocolate, dark cherries, light tobacco. Smooth texture, full body, roasty bitter-sweet finish. An impressive beer, the complexity of the barrels on this beer is phenomenal.

Jan 10 2016: Very dark ruby pour, with a tan head with good retention. Rich smell of bourbon, milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, dark cherries, roasted malts and vanilla. Very well balanced taste, with notes of bourbon that do not overwhelm, followed by dark cherries, milk chocolate, vanilla and cocoa. Silky smooth texture and a very well balanced taste, not too sweet, not too bitter and not too boozy. 4.9/5

Bottle shared with MF666. Dark brown close to black with a small tan head. Roasted malt, vanilla and caramel in the nose. Flavour has syrup, vanilla, chocolate, wood. Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation, heavy sweet. Soft. Dry finish. Big beer.
Bottle @ New Years Eve 15. Oily black pour with a small tan head. Notes of bourbon, vanilla, honey, malty sweet, light syrup, molasses, chocolate and some light savory notes.
Bottle. Pours black with no real head. Nose is bourbon, oak and dark chocolate. Taste adds some anise. Great.

2015 Release

L:
-pours the darkest of brown with no light coming through and a tiny,quickly dissipating head
S:
-chocolate,vanilla,coconut,bourbon,molas chocolate,bourbonvanilla,syrup,molasses,caramel,to and dry finish
F:
-low to medium carbonation
-medium to full body
-boozy
O:
An absolute flavour Bomb.

No 002 from 2011. So its got some age. All I got to say is Wow! This is a fantastic beer. Not much bourbon at this point but still present. Smooth mouthfeel with carbonation. Lots of vanilla, coconut, toast, bourbon and warm flavor. Alcohol is very well hidden (age). Some cherries and other fruit. Super enjoyable.

2012 Tap at barrelworks, buellton. Black color, tanned head. Rich roasty aroma has coffee and chocolate notes. Super smooth palate, rich roasty, coffee, chocolate, vanilla. Nearly perfect imperial stout.

2015 vintage. Near black with a thin, dissipating light brown head. Delightful aroma with the bourbon barrel character prominent but well integrated. Flavor is even better. Tips sweet. Complex and approachable. Pleasant alcohol warmth that doesnt reveal the 14% abv. Lighter full body. Still very drinkable. Worth the nonsense to get a bottle. Everything you want in a BBA Imperial stout.
High pitch, sweet bourbon aroma. Chocolate. Roast. Taste is strong bourbon, cream and roast. Excellent.

Bouteille 650ml, gracieuseté de Erik-P lors du CanBIF Fall 2015, Thanks Erik! Couleur brun très foncé presque opaque, mousse moka foncée aérienne et fugace. Arôme boisé, malt torréfié, alcool, chocolat, Bourbon. Goût de malt torréfié, chocolat noir, alcool présent mais en même temps bien camouflé (aussi étrange que cela puisse paraître), boisé, café, touche de caramel, chaleur dalcool en fin de bouche. Carbonatation faible, corps dense.

Bottle. Poured a deep dark black with a small sudsy khaki head. Aromas of baking chocolate, leather, huge bourbon presence, wood, and roast. Flavor was bourbon heavy up front, bitter chocolate, leather, light tobacco, charred wood. Full body, oily texture, average carbonation, alcohol burn to finish. Very big beer and a sipper here.

UPDATED: NOV 26, 2016 Oily, black pour with creamy, brown head. Aroma has dark malts, bourbon, caramel and butterscotch. Taste follows with the same notes, slightly sweet but not cloying. Big barrel notes with vanilla and toasted coconut. Heavy body with creamy mouthfeel. Alcohol is really well hidden. Had multiple vintages of this beer and all of them have been fantastic. This is probably the most consistently well made barrel aged imperial stout on the market.
Bottle (22oz $17): Black with small tan head. Great stout. Some bitter swwet chocolate taste with some warming with a little bitterness in the end. Not terribly complex. but very well done.

Nice aroma of bourbon, dark chocolate, and vanilla. Some raisin also. Ebony, black with razor tan head. Sweet up front. Bourbon, charcoal, bitter chocolate, some plum. Bitterness is light, alcohol burn is nice on finish. SMOOTH!!!!!!! Very nice
On tap at tap takeover at blue palms, LA. Super rich imperial stout, the roast is overtaken by the rich sweetness and alcohol. Bourbon barrel is very prominent, bourbon strong. Very good.

Color is perfect dark. The smell is raisin and alcohol, mellows in smell to chocolate as it warms up. A sweet initial taste then a slight booze with raisin middle that dissipates quickly with a following by a great coco/chocolate. Nice subtle finish. Its top contender. I prefer abraxas, prarie BOMB, KBS.

On draught at Rattle 'n Hum. Pours a pitch black with a small tanned head. Solid lacing. Nose is dominated by milk chocolate. It smells like choc milk. Taste is pure choc milk with powdered chocolate and espresso. Really fucking smooth. 14% abv not evident. Sensational beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours black with a small brown head. Head retention is ok. AROMA: rich complex dark roasted malts, chocolate, oak barrel char, roasty, floral, alcohol, earthy, toffee, vanilla, raisin, coffee, banana liqueur, slight chili pepper, cinnamon, dates, brown sugar, molasses, herbal hops, bourbon, caramel and light peppercorn. TASTE: rich dark roasted malts, chocolate, oak barrel char, roasty, alcohol, earthy, toffee, coffee, vanilla, raisin, dates, brown sugar, banana liqueur, floral, light chili pepper, cinnamon, molasses, hop spice, bourbon, caramel, dark stone fruit and light peppercorn. AFTER TASTE: bourbon, chocolate, rich malt and spices with a smooth medium rich finish.

22oz bottle have had many times. I love this beer with a year or two on it. Pours out ink black topped with a brown head. Nose is very nice marshmallow fluff roast malts chocolate coffee vanilla and plenty sweetness. Taste is more of the sweetness brown sugar molasses marshmallow roast malts chocolate a nice barrel kick. Always very good.

Brown bottle, 650 ml, 2011 vintage, savoured on September 11 2015; eye: liquorice, opaque, thin sheet of brown head, no lacing; nose: roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, slight burnt barley, molasses; mouth: roasted barley, chocolate, alcohol, alcohol warmth, slight pepper, rich, molasses, finale in chocolate with presence of alcohol, full body, below-average carbonation, lightly bitter, lightly sweet, creamy, oily and silky texture; overall: quite good

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 650 ml, millésime 2011, savourée le 11 septembre 2015; il : réglisse, opaque, mince couverture de mousse brune, pas de dentelle; nez : orge torréfiée, chocolat, alcool, très léger orge brûlée, mélasse; bouche : orge torréfiée, chocolat, alcool, chaleur dalcool, très léger poivre, riche, mélasse, finale en chocolat avec présence dalcool, corsée, carbonatation sous la moyenne, légèrement amère, légèrement sucrée, texture crémeuse, huileuse et soyeuse; en résumé : bien bon

2012 Bottle, 12.5%abv. Dark brown color with small medium brown head with no lacing and oily legs. Aroma has big wood notes and subtle bourbon, with cocoa and coffee. Flavor is sharp up front, with faint hints of bourbon, a little bitter, with a strong roasted coffee, smoky finish and creamy cocoa aftertaste. Surprised the alcohol is still a bit strong after 3 years.

Sous une robe brune-foncée se cache un superbe Stout impérial puissant. Un nez dune intensité exemplaire avec du chocolat fondu en quantité industrielle, du bourbon, du tabac de Joliette. La bouche a une superbe texture crémeuse, des saveurs riches de chocolat noir, de noix de coco et de bourbon. Une finale sur lalcool laisse une petite lueur sous les yeux. Jadore. Merci Pat.

Parabola montre ses couleurs: le bourbon domine son nez mais enrobe les malts et nuance le tout de vanille, de noix de coco et de caramel. En bouche, le bourbon est chaleureux mais bon. Dommage que ce soit du déjà vu. Je mattendais à quelque chose dunique et de très bon et je tombe sur une chose cent fois faite, bonne et superbement exécutée. Suis-je déçu? Et bien non. La bouche est soyeuse. Le pétillement est bas. La finale est assez chaude, très bourbon et très noix de coco encore une fois et un peu collante avec ce sucre qui reste aux commissures de mes lèves. Un autre monstre de bu pour moi.

Taste from a bomber in Binnys Lincoln Park tasting room. Flavor is rich and bourbonny. A little on the sweet side and also a little astringent on the finish. Slightly fruity. Good, but in a world with an ever increasing number of great bourbon barrel aged stouts, I dont see this one as really standing out.

Schwarze Farbe, geringe bräunliche schaumkrone. Geruch intensiv röstmalzig, viel Schokolade, bourbon, Kakao, Vanille, leicht alkoholisch. Geschmack kräftig nach Vanille, Kakao, Kaffee, bourbon, alkoholisch, vollmundig, lecker.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2015 Famous barrel aged RIS with pretty thick, creamy, dense, yellowish beige head and very dark chestnut brown colour, yellowish on the edges, hazy. Very strong, overpowering and multi-layered aroma of chocolate sauce, espresso beans, cured meat, strong bourbon, dry oak, vanilla-like tannins, cinnamon, pipe tobacco, pepper, banana liqueur, amaretto, iron, raisins, bayleaf, home made caramel, accents of shoe polish, barbecue sausages, cocoa, flowers, rosewater. Taste starts with a condensed candied sweetness of raisins soaked in rhum and candied cherries, drying in instants but supported by a rich, deep, oily, multi-layered maltiness, chocolatey, deeply caramelly, evolving into roasted coffee bitterness, but not too charred and countered by a very dry woodiness with softish vanilla tannin flavours, with a lot of warming bourbon alcohol. Very complex, with a very stilish packing.  Truly epic, big cheers to Jan for sharing this precious bottle!

Wow! So smooth and balanced. I can't even describe the mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

650 mL bottle poured into a snifter. 2011 bottle consumed in 2012. Black body with a small khaki head. Poor retention. Sticky looking as it swirls in the glass. Looks like it could be a sugar bomb.
Big barrel aroma. Not all bourbon, though. Along with the bourbon is a fair dose of vanilla and some heavy roasted malt from the stout. Some of the stout comes through, but its mostly barrel. Taste is vanilla and bourbon up front followed seamlessly by chocolate and coffee roasted malts. Hefty bitterness, but not excessive. Adds complexity and a nice bite. Really spectacular flavor.
Thick, but not too sweet. Low carbonation without being sluggish to drink. A wonderful stout.
Bottle - Pours dark black. Nose is oak, bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate. Taste is fudgy, bourbon, vanilla and oak. Rich and decadent. Just great!
One of the best Bourbon barrel aged stout's I've eve tried. Not too coffee heavy, a hint of chocolate, vanilla and the bourbon notes are very well balanced.
Poured from tap nearly black with a thin beige head. Aromas of chocolate licorice bourbon and oak. Taste is smooth and follows aroma and is quite boozy. Could use some cellaring.

Draft. Pours black with creme colored head that lingers. Mild licorice aroma over light carbonation. Viscous mouthfeel. Boozy, caramel and chocolate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draft at Grill Next Door. Pours nearly black with a scant beige head. Aroma is dark chocolate, molasses, bourbon, oak. Flavor is dark chocolate, licorice, lots of oak and bourbon. This is very good, but would benefit from some cellaring.
Draught. This is a big bad beast of a beer with so much depth and nuance it is hard to describe. Seek it out and consume.

Bottle. Heavy malt aromas of toasted, dark chocolate and molasses, moderate resin and earth for the hops and yeast, with notes of bourbon, licorice, tar and alcohol. Head is small, creamy, brown with slipper lacing and good legs, and is mostly diminishing. Color is black. Flavor starts moderately sweet and lightly acidic, then finishes lightly sweet and acidic and lightly to moderately bitter. Palate is full, syrupy, with a soft carbonation and a lightly to moderately alcoholic finish. Super dark and rich in aromas and flavors, and all in perfect balance. World class Imperial Stout.

Tasted from bottle. Pours black with dark brown head. Amazing aroma of chocolate, coffee, bourbon. Taste definitely does not disappoint. Flavors of chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits, spices, caramel, toffee, coffee. Syrup and clingy mouthfeel. Moderately sweet with mild to moderate bitterness. You do get a little alcohol burn from the high ABV. Overall an amazing imperial stout. Definitely one of the best I've ever had.
