Fantastic beer. Drank it side by side with BCBS and could hardly tell a difference. Black pour from 22oz bottle at home. Full whiskey, vanilla, coconut, chocolate and cocoa flavor. Outstanding beer

this one tastes identical to bourbon county brand stout. so much we did a side by side and there is almost no difference. strong notes of roasted coffee, chocaolate, and bourbon. super smooth and soft on the pallette. top 5 stout anyday.

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2016 On tap at BBDs..poured into a snifter..jet black thin tan head..aroma of bourbon,coffee,chocolate,oak,molasses..tastes of bourbon,vanilla,oak,
chocolate,licorice..top notch.
Finally a beer that lived up to the hype! This was truly worth the hassle of obtaining. Taste mouthful is world class. Creamy burbon explosion describes it best.
Pours jet black with very little head retention and no lacing. Smells of caramel and butterscotch. A very good beer. Tastes like butterscotch and you can really taste the bourbon in this. Love it!

On tap at WOB in Arlington, TX. Black in color with a good sized tan head. Aroma is of prune, dried berries, dark chocolate, oak, vanilla, cocoa, toffee, and notes of marzipan, rum cake, and coconut. Taste is of chocolate chip cookies, cola, prune, molasses, oak, vanilla, dark chocolate, booze, and spiced cake.

@blue cbc 2015
alcohol, caramell, vanilla, extremly sweet, light bitter, not that balanced
Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of sweet malt and cocoa. Flavor is the same plus dark fruit and licorice.
Poured that deep black color, and I could catch that hint of oatmeal with smell, but was pretty subtle. Was not as creamy and smooth as I expected but still extraordinary

Oh why, mess around-- I love this beer and have for years. It is everything a big impy stout should be...viscous, balanced flavors (of anise, cocoa, coffee, and molasses), semi-sweet, and just plain unflawed. love it.

Draft at Cogans Pizza. Pours a deep brown to black with a tiny rim of creamy light brown head. Aroma is an amazing mix of cocoa, roasted malts, huge vanilla, touch of bourbon. Flavor has a nice sweetness to it, light roasted malts, vanilla. Alcohol is well hidden, creamy body. Exquisite.

Tap @CBC15. Black with big creamy white head. Roasted aroma, coffee and light licorice. Thick, slick mouthfeel. Bittersweet licorice with cocoa and coffee notes. Long, sticky and bitter finish. Good stuff.

651 ml. bottle. Vintage 2015. Pours a medium, gradually diminishing, beige head, with minimal lacing over a black (SRM 50) body.......nose is tobacco, Bourbon, fruits including raisin, plum, cocoa, chocolate from the roasted malts, minimal hops, boveril, balance to the malts.......taste is sweet with dried fruits including plum, raising, cherry, fig, brown sugar notes, mild cocoa, chocolate, with slight coffee from the roasted malts, Bourbon, vanilla, tobacco, finishing with a light hop/roasted malt bitterness, balance to the malts.......mouth feel, thick chewy body, alcohol burn slightly present, carbonation makes a creamy mouthful. This is a rich, thick, heavy, sweet, complex beer. It is more on the sweet/desert end of the style, with minimal umami notes. The alcohol is almost, but not quite, hidden by the heavy sweetness. The sweetness is almost too dominant. BJCP 9/3/16/4/8
Sample at cbc. Dark fruit, roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol bourbon, wood. red brown color nice foam, full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish,
-short review cbc- molasses, cherry, chocolate, spicy alcohol. Super slick. Well refined imperial stout

2015 edition. Poured from a bomber into a chalice on 03.25.15.

A: Bourbon, chocolate, fig, vanilla, raisin oatmeal, dark fruit, allspice, and molasses. Amazing smell. Bourbon dominant, but balanced.

A: 1/2 finger off-white head, which recedes quickly to a ring with spots of foam. Black body with lots of see through brown and red in the glass.

T: Bourbon, raisin oatmeal, cherry, and molasses dominate. Oak woodiness, nuttiness, vanilla, and allspice are subtle.

P: Silky smooth. Its on the lighter side, but still somewhat syrupy.

O: Its amazingly complex. The alcohol is hidden for 14% ABV, though it does warm nicely. Bourbon dominates, but all of the flavors are balanced. Its a world class beer.

On tap a Frisco, Columbia. Dark brown black with thin tan head. Aroma is oaky, boozy, molasses, vanilla and Cuban cigars. Starts of with alcohol warmth and dark chocolate, molasses and vanilla. Finish is roasty dark chocolate and vanilla. It is a sipper, but I had trouble sipping it because it was just so tasty.

On tap at Frisco with Maxbier for a rare weeknight outing. Poured dark brown with amber tint and tan colored head. Aroma is molasses, caramel, bourbon, and oak. Flavor is sweet caramel, raisins, brown sugar, molasses bourbon oak and bittersweet chocolate. Finishes with lingering dark chocolate. Another amazing Firestone Walker offering.

This is the 2015 parabola. 
Amazing the aromas. There is choc cherry and vanilla in this dark brown brew with no head. A choc cherry cordial. The taste is choc sweet woody as the after taste comes the wood comes out along with cherry and a warming taste from the 14%. It's full bodied and low carb. A great beer.

650 ml bottle, 2014 edition at 14% ABV, shared with Werckmeister.
Almost black body, with a medium, creamy, beige, yellowish head.
Very complex, perfectly balanced, smooth aroma of bourbon, coffee, dark chocolate, just the right amount of booze, various barrel notes, dark and dried fruits.
Taste is also wonderfully big, more boozy than the nose, but also greatly balanced, with bourbon, smooth coffee, caramel, melting chocolate, dried and dark fruits, liquorice and so much more...
Full, oily mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes roasty, alcoholic, a bit astringent, but very smooth, complex, with coffe, dark chocolate, barrel notes, some liquorice, cocoa.

Wow! Heavy and smooth at the same time. Alcohol is present, but surprisingly well balanced for the ABV. A wonderful, very complex, comfortable sipper. One of the best Imperial Stouts Ive had so far!

bottle kindly shared by Saeglopur, many thanks :) very nice oily texture, black color, small coffee-colored head. smells very liqueurish, some wooden notes, some malty sweetness, coffee, caramel, some alcohol, light dried fruits, dried boletus, some alcohol, molasses. full body, full mouthfeel, very slick, soft carbonation. tastes liqueurish, some sweetness, alocoholic, wooden notes again, some light roasty notes, brown sugar, coffee, caramel. malty sweet / liqueurish finish. wow. strong and sweet and alcoholic (for the high ABV quite hidden though), but I like it.
At 14 percent you are always going taste the alcohol but this is pretty smooth at the end of day.
Licorice and Spanish cedar aroma. Taste like French roast coffee mildly carbonated with a touch of bourbon as the alcohol heats up mouthfeel .

Parabola 12 vintage

Many thanks to Kevin for the bottle.

Pours a black color, with a decent, bubbly head.

Aromas reveal a rich Bourbon note among chocolate, coffee and wood. The Bourbon is very well pronounced, hovering on top of sweet, toffeeish malts, bakers chocolate and molasses, well balanced between sweet, earthy and bitter aromas. Toffee and hot Bourbon blend outstandingly well into each other, with coffee playing a balancing role, bittering the nose. 

Drinks incredibly smooth, revealing the rich, decadent body of the beer, with almost no carbonation necessary to showcase its complexity. 

While the Bourbon is very prominent on the nose, it is well integrated into the beers taste, due to earthy malts, wood and creamy milk chocolate, balancing the bourbonic impact. It tastes quite hot though, with coffee blending into the oak incredibly well, exhibiting a slightly dry quality, absorbed by sweeter chocolate with lots of cream. The bitternes turns quite prominent, due to the wooden, hot bite, inviting matured hops and coffee to the tongue. Until the very end, coffee and chocolate are on par, leading to a semi-dry, slightly burning finish.

Fantastic brew, outstandingly balanced, while providing an amazing depth. Wooden coffee and creamy milk chocolate are balancing the Bourbon artfully, both staying recognizable until the finish, while their taste gets gently transformed due to luscious, slightly dry, warming Bourbon and notes of coconut, as well as vanilla.

Black with dark red/brown head. Lots of bourbon, chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Same characteristics follow in the flavor along with dark dried fruit and vanilla. Expected some soy or fish sauce notes which seems typical of the style, but they never appeared - this is not a bad thing. Full bodied, rich and very satisfying.

The liquid is a deep, impenetrable, inescapable black that pours thick and viscous with a small, sudsy head the color of cinnamon. Some thin spots of lace pepper the glass as the liquid recedes while you drink. Take a whiff and youll pick up tons of toasted coconut, some vanilla, charred oak, and maybe even a little tobacco. Your next sniff might reveal espresso, high-cacao-percentage dark chocolate, or the subtle zing of spicy Hallertau hops. A night spent pondering Parabola is a lesson in the merits of restraint. A problem rampant among barrel-aged stouts is that they often let one flavor (whiskey, usually) take the reins and overwhelm the beer. Here, individual flavors are there if youre willing to look for them, but theres also a nice synthesis -- like a rainbow, with each flavor fading softly into the other. And what flavors are discernible are mighty fine: first is the darker, bitter stuff like cocoa nibs and espresso powder. Sweeter notes soon emerge, reminding of vanilla beans, toasted coconut, dark plums and cherry syrup. A gentle amount of bitterness (delivered by citrusy/woody Zeus hops) keeps this sweeter stout from becoming cloying. The mouthfeel is blissful, with a velvety smoothness not unlike a milkshake. I want to make a bed and sleep in it. Bubbles massage the tongue lightly and the beer fizzes up only very slightly as it moves. The brewers must also be commended for their skill in covering up the alcohol burn. This is 13 percent alcohol -- nearly liqueur-strength -- and I dont pick up a hint of it. The drinkability of this boozy stout is downright dangerous. World-class.

750ml bottle at home. Black color with dark beige head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, dark fruits, plums, bourbon, wood, light alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium to full oily to creamy body with soft carbonation.
Strong bourbon and oak aroma. Pours clear brown with some lacing around the glass. Burnt chocolate and bourbon flavors.
7.11.2014. 2014 version. Pleasant bourbon aroma with vanilla, bourbon, tobacco, oak, nuts. Taste is also quite complex, oaky vanilla, berries, tobacco.

Awesome beer. Deep taste. Great alcohol content. Really good after rate that starts for quite some time. Chocolate, coffee, oak, deep cherry.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a viscous black colour with no head. Aroma is coconut, cocoa and caramel. Taste is caramel, bourbon, vanilla and slight coconut. Oily mouthfeel.
Draft - Coconut, chocolate and nice barrel notes. Deep jet brow with a nice brown head. Coconut, chocolate, caramel and vanilla. Great.

Régóta várt jövevény, elegáns megjelenésű legenda a Firestone Walker csúcskategóriás imperial stoutja, mely fortyogó fekete testű szörnyetegként mutatkozik be, minden tekintetet magára szegezve, tekintélyt parancsoló módon nyilatkoztatja ki kimondatlanul is egyértelmű felsőbbrendűségét. Minden egyes mozzanatát mélyen az emlékezetünkbe véssük, kezdve kecses aromáival, melyek között hosszú órákra elidőznénk. Mértani pontossággal megtervezett illataiban elmerülve ritkán tapasztalt mértékű eleganciával szembesülünk, ezek azok a benyomások, amelyek szavatolják a további élmények feledhetetlen jellegét. A tölgyes és bourbon-központú jegyek puha étcsokoládé és prémium minőségű ízesített kávé hangulatát hordozzák magukon, minden egyes komponens mesterien visszafogott, ugyanakkor teljes mértékben rabul ejtő szerkezetben karol egymásba. A fás és amolyan finoman földes jegyek csodálatos harmóniában olvadnak egybe a csokoládés és alkoholos, nápolyis-csemegeszerű és tüzes malátás, egyszerre könnyed és markáns aromákkal. A varázslat azonban folytatódik, az első kortyok által nyilvánvalóvá válik, mit is kell, hogy jelentsen egy minőségi főzet esetében a tökéletes test. Olvadékony szerkezete mennyei mannaként tölti be szánknak minden egyes szegletét, olajos és pezsgően csípős keretbe foglalva zúdul ránk a folyékony csokoládé pikáns módon elkészített megannyi változata. Sötét tónusú vanília, tölgyfachips, kókuszos nyalánkságok ömlenek be szabályozott mederbe terelt folyamként, az édesség, fűszeres alkoholosság és tartalommal teli keserűség kibogozhatatlan egysége érzékszerveket gyönyörködtető módon tárul elénk. Egyszerűen lehengerlő az a fajta intenzitás és fajsúlyos karakter, amit mindenféle agresszivitást nélkülözve, az előbbiekben kifejtett módon hordoz magán a sör, ezáltal pedig szerény véleményem szerint mindenféleképpen az egyik legjobb, valaha előállított imperial stout.

On tap at the Blue Monkey Tavern. Pours pitch black with a one finger tan head with excellent lacing. Aroma is of dark fruits, bourbon, espresso, anise, bakers coco, pipe tobacco, coconut, sweet malts, molasses, and maybe just a little booze. Taste is bourbon, roasted malts, dark fruits, tobacco, coconut, molasses, anise, espresso, dark and milk coco, woody notes, and a little booze. Has a full body with a super creamy, slightly oily, velvety, semi bitter, warning, slightly hot, long, lingering finish. Overall, a incredibly complex, world class imperial stout, that hides its extreme abv very well.
Negro opaco, espuma beis oscura. Aromas se burbon, maíz, chocolate y licor. Cuerpo denso. Sabor de bourbon y chocolate, melaza con final licoroso y trago cálido.

22 oz bottle shared by Spencer. 2014 vintage. The pour is a solid black (not as dark on the pour as I'd like) there is just a thin ring of khaki colored head and no lacing to be found. The aroma is pretty solid. There is a lot of bourbon barrel character. A nice bourbon aroma and an oaky vanilla to go along with a nice dark fruit presence. The flavor is a lot boozier than I was expecting. The bourbon flavor is incredibly strong. There is a vanilla segment and then through a nice dark fruit and to the roasted malt. The mouthfeel isn't as good as I was hoping to see, but it does carry a good creaminess to it. The finish is dry, with a lingering licorice and some good bourbon tendencies to it. Very good

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had the honor of experiencing this brew on tap at the New England Tap House Grill in Hooksett NH on 5/28/14. This was one of those ultra-surprising unexpected finds on their(or anyones) rotating beer list. 

The beer was poured into a snifter glass and the first glance offered up one dark beauty of a beer. Mostly black with hints of brown on the edge when hit by the right lighting. No head to speak of just a slight mocha ring around the top and virtually no lacing as well. Smells of, well, bourbon. Some vanilla, aged oak, dark coffee, and some espresso also join in with the abundance of bourbon. Taste is great with the hints of the above mentioned with bourbon being the most pronounced flavor for me. Very well done mouthfeel that coats the palate and is very smooth. I found Parabola to be moderately sweet and extremely easy to drink, but a sipper with that high abv. I really enjoyed this aged stout tremendously and it was amazing to get a hold of this masterpiece . Highly recommended!

Number 50 impy stout and 300 total rates! Bottle, opaque black, good walnut colored head, decent lace. Aroma plums, cherries, figs, vanilla, toasted barley, bourbon, anise, molases. Taste is molases, anise, plums, oak, vanilla, cherries, milk chocolate, little sweet, palate is thick and chewy, carbonation very subdued, finish is dry, and a little hot. This is 2014 vintage, and I feel like it could use another 6-12 mo. cellar. Still, this is exceptional.
Bottle. Color clear black with medium creamy head. Aroma malt, dark chocolate, coffee, wood, alcohol. Taste sweetbitter, alcohol, wood, chocolate, coffee.
22oz bottle pours A dark oily black with a tan head. Roasted malts chocolate and bourbon taste

[Bottle (650ml). Reserve Series No. 001] Pours a very dark brown, almost black, with a small diminishing frothy light-brown head. Aroma of brown sugar, leafy hops, alcohol, chocolate, wood and maple syrup. Flavour of roasted malt, leafy hops, alcohol, wood and brown sugar. Medium bodied, syrupy mouthfeel. At least a year old and still pretty boozy, still very good though.

Bottle from bier.de, 2014 vintage. Pours clear black with an thin white head. Smells like bourbon and oak and vanilla and chocolate and lots of good stuff. Light to medium carbonation, oily but ever so slightly thin compared to the big oaty beasts of the imperial stout world. Rich dark roast, milk chocolate, caamel, treacle, refined sugar, loads of vanilla and oak char. Sweet and smooth on the palate, slick and oily on the tongue. Finishes long and roasty. Smooth enough to make every sip a pleasure and yet enough heat to remind you that youre drinking a 13% imperial stout that has enjoyed the benefit of plenty of barrel time. You can probably count the number of BA imperial stouts that are better than this on a single hand.

2014. A worthy 100th rating. Pours "light" blackwith lasting tan head. Aroma of chocolate tobacco vanilla and mild bourbon. taste of chocolate forward followed by light vanilla cocoa powder and tobacco. Thick velvety mouth feel. The flavors are a little harsh at this point, would benefit significantly with age. Overall excellent Imperial Stout

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2015 Aroma of licorice, bourbon, booze, and booze. Super boozy and very light mouthfeel. Feels like a darker barley wine, quite dry, very very light mouthfeel, some vanilla, loaded with coconut, the flavours dont integrate very well and not very much of a stout, more like a Barley wine with some darker malts, too dry, too light mouthfeel, and probably the booziest beers Ive had, even though it was 2012 vintage.
Cant say enough about the flavors of this one. Chocolate cherries coffee dates cake cigar tobacco its like a drizzle for cheese cake.
On tap pours jet black with tan head and good lacing. Aroma is sweet malt, chocolate, oak, bourban, tabacco. Flavor is sweet oak bourban, chocolate, coffee.

Aromas of coffee, dark chocolate, grilled cherry, tobacco, raw cacao, toasted coconut, freshly baked macaroons, subtle vanilla, subtle booze, subtle char. Black, mostly lasting chocolate ice cream-colored head. Dry, deep, super complex, flavor profile mirroring the array of aromatics, earthy, chocolatey, redolent of cooked and dried cherries and berries. Full bodied, quite smooth especially considering the ABV, deep, a sipping beer for sure, possibly the greatest Ive had to date.
Black pour. Nice aroma of dark chocolate, vanilla, toasted malt, and a bit of coffee.

Bottle from a trade. Many thanks Wyatt! Dark brown/black colour, brown foam. Soft carbonation. Complex aroma of roasted malts, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla and caramel. Medium sweet, light bitter. Well balanced. Good Bourbon Barrel Aged Stout.
I'm not well versed in the art of beer reviews so I'm not going to make up a bunch of stuff. I will say that it is a hearty beer that does not go too strong on the bourbon flavor.

Bottle: Thanks Victor: Vintage 2011: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Black beer with a small brown head.
Aroma of bourbon, roast, chocolate, wood, forest spices.
Flavours of chocolate, marshmellow, marzipan, bourbon, roast, light alcohol burn, dark chocolate, bitter, mocha, some wood, some vanilla, some clay.
Aftertaste of dark chocolate, mocha, roast, some bourbon and wood notes.
Low carbo, silky mouthfeel, fuller bodied and a light sticky texture.
Nice stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: On tap. Pour is close to black with a very thin white head. Aroma and flavor of dark chocolate, peat, oak, tobacco, and herbal hops. Finish is slightly bitter with the booze coming through. Solid.

2014 vinatge, bottle. Pours a pitch black, fairly opaque with a nice bubbly mocha colored head that breaks into a nice ring around the glass with some spotty lacing. Nose is loaded with bourbon, wet oak, dark chocolate and coffee. Taste is silky smooth with the chocolate and coffee dancing around the palate early before moving into a bittering tobacco/dark chocolate/char notes. The coffee lingers into the vanilla, oak and the bourbon finishes them all off nicely! Great beer!

Dunkelbraun bis schwarz. In der Nase intensiv ohne Ende. Vanille, Eiche, Bourbon, Karamell, Schokolade, geröstete Kokosnuss, dunkler Zucksr. Am Gaumen wärmend, Vanille, Bourbon, Röstmalz, gegen Ende Bitterschoko und Kaffee, leicht herb leicht alkoholisch. Unfassbar cremig und angenehm. Boom.
Dark brown, near black. Roasty make aroma, some barrel and light coffee. Taste is bitter chocolate, bitter hops and some oak, vanilla and booze. Nothing g to complain about here.

660ml bottle - thanks VastActiv and the rest of the Hel crowd!
Black with reddish glints, small tan head. Sticky roasty aroma, ooooh - crazy sweet. Taste is just stupidly sweet. Some vanilla is nice. But apart from that all Im getting is sweetness, sugar, sweet stuff, sugary stuff, and sweetness. Predictably sticky palate. Almost undrinkable due to its absurd sugariness.

660ml bottle (tasting @VastActive place, thanks). Clear very dark brown color. Medium size, brownish head, stays. Sweet, caramel, malty notes in aroma. Caramel, toffee, malty, sweet notes in taste. Alcohol is there, but not disturbing. Sweet malty aftertaste. Nice one!

2014 vintage bomber poured into proprietors glass. Poured dark black with a minimal head. Knock your socks off bourdon and dark chocolate aromas. I mean wow, incredible. Incredible dark coffee and chocolate taste, strongly accompanied by the bourbon. What an incredible beer. Wish I had the pleasure of this wonderful brew every night.
Its been a long time since Ive had it. Pour from a bottle is a nice opaque black with a sweet malty aroma. Taste is coffee with a hint of chocolate. Leaves a smooth rich after taste.

Been in the cellar for 2 years? Guess I wont need to buy beer at the game. Thick brown head on dark liquid. Big boozy scent; booze, bourbon aroma that clears the sinuses and intoxicates the mind. Goose bumps, chocolate, bourbon, molasses and ambrosia.
Aroma carries a bourbony boozy vanilla, caramel, and coconut character. Deep black color. Flavors are intense with charred wood, booze (vanilla, caramel, and cocnut) dominating. Outstanding beer.

Got in a trade with cyde. 22 ounce bottle into snifter; 2013 vintage, bottled on 3/18/2013. Pours pitch black color with a 1-2 finger dense tan head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, toasted coconut, toffee, oak, bourbon, tobacco, light char, and roast/oak earthiness; with some light alcohol/booze. Very nice aromas with good balance and complexity of dark/roasted malt and oak barrel notes; with solid strength. Taste of big milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, toasted coconut, toffee, bourbon, oak, tobacco, light char, and roast/oaky earthiness. Fair amount of roast/oak bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of milk chocolate, cocoa, coffee, vanilla, toasted coconut, toffee, bourbon, oak, tobacco, light char, and roast/oak earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity and robustness of dark/roasted malt and oak barrel flavors; with a great malt/barrel balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. A very slight oak astringency was present but not detrimental. Light-medium carbonation an full bodied; with a very smooth, creamy, and fairly slick mouthfeel that is fantastic. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a light warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible barrel aged imperial stout. All around outstanding complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt and bourbon barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. An insanely delicious offering as I expected.

650 ml bottle. Pours a very dark brown with moderate tan head. Aromas of dark caramel, brown sugar syrup, and a bit of dark fruit. Flavors are similar and sweet with addition bourbon and oak notes. Very warm finish. Reminds me of a barley wine.

Draught at Mikkeller, black sensation. Smell of vanilla and some alcohol. Pours black with a small beige head. Taste is full and nice and holds some vanilla and chocolates. Palate is oily yet quiet drinkable. Overall a good beer, easy to drink though it can be described as a big beer.

Bomber. 14%. 2014 vintage. Courtesy of olio. Thanks so much Toni! Enjoyed at the ISKTR 2014. 
Black colour with a tiny tan head.
Sweetness, malt, mild hops, mild bitterness, tobacco bitterness and mild whiskey notes in the aroma. Delicious!
The flavour is... heavenly... Bitterness, roasted malt, sweetness, vanilla, hops and chocolate. Delicious! 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draught at Mikkeller bar.Pitch black colour with no head.Aroma of vanilla and tobacco, strong Bourbon flavour and warming and vinious mouth feels with hint of vanilla really nice.

UPDATED: DEC 5, 2014 (on tap @ Mikkeller) Pours black with no head (and way too cold). The initial impression from the aroma is that its like Bourbon County Stout 2012 with some bourbon/coconut/vanilla notes. Upon warming further complexity is revealed notably among which are sherry, prunes, oak barrel finally culminating in a licorice note. Oily texture, full body, soft carbonation and an intensely warming and rather boozy finish. Flavour has notes of sherry, raisins and booze. Its a bit too boozy for my taste especially when drunk from a small and narrow sampler-like glass as is used in Mikkeller Bar. A small amount served in a big snifter or burgundy glass would be fun to toss around sitting in a comfy chair in front of a fireplace and observe how the aroma develops. Girlfriend says: "Its complex and very pleasant!"

05-NOV-2014, draft @Mikkeller Bar, @Black Sensation. Rating #3000:-)
Black with no head at all. Aroma is mostly Bourbon. Some chocolate underneat but mostly Bourbon. 
Taste is Bourbon, chocolate and refined roast. Alcohol is very present. Very fine, soft carbonation of small tingling bubbles. Sweet, big body.
One of the big ones. A fantastic drink. Would love to taste it Again.

Draught @ Mikkeller bar Viktoriagade, Black Sensation event. Aroma is sweet, vinous, dark fruits, raisins, licorice root, bitter dark chocolate, cherries, wood, vanilla and coffee. Flavour is sweet and slighty bitter. Full bodied, very thick texture. Well balanced finish with a long and subtle coffee aftertaste.

UPDATED: AUG 17, 2015 Tap & bottled. Pours pitch black body with a small, lacing tan head. Aroma of roasted malt coffe, chocolate, bourbon, wood and dark fruit notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with alcohol notes. Medium to full bodied, oily texture and flat to soft carbonnation. A great Impy.

On tap @ Mikkeller. Pours black with a small beige head. Aroma is of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate and raisins. Taste is of roasted malts, chocolate, very balanced notes of bourbon, coffee and a hint of licorice and hops. Full body and below average carbonation. Sweet with a port-like feel to it. Very very good and very balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 2013 shared bottle in 2014; 2016 shared bottle in 2017. 

A bit less complex (flavor but not aroma) than the Black Tuesday that preceded this, with more coffee and higher bitterness. ABV seems much lower than 19.2%! or 18%, respectively. 

Dark chocolate and coffee linger on in the aftertaste, with plenty of dark roasted grains. Very faint burnt toast component.

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2015 Shared bottle with a great and generous friend. Thank you.

Black pour, off-white head, mocha and coffee out of the gate. The subtlety of the aroma is striking as it is also very bold, and the first sip brings in a wave of flavor; boozy cocoa with a sultry, dark, heavily herbal back-end. Smoky almost. The medium body carries it through with a comfortable presence that would probably make converts of almost any sad soul "afraid of dark beer". The head didnt stick around long, but the flavor did; the body holds up nicely against time and the finish lasts long on my lips. All in all, an amazing experience. Firestone Walker, another grand experience. Thanks!
Taste is chocolate, roasted barley, coffee. Taste is verg sweet. Great stuff but Stickee Monkey was better. Super stuff tho.

Pours a dark, dark brown almost black color with khaki colored head. Barrel, cocoa, roasted malt, and some bourbon on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with a bit of barrel and some maple like sweetness. But a bit thin on the mouthfeel. Delicious.

Transfer from BA review on 4-8-14-

 Poured from bottle into a snifter 

 Appearance  The beer pours an almost pitch black color with a one finger of cream colored head. The head has a good level of retention, slowly fading to leave a moderate level of lace on the sides of the glass. The thickness of the brew can be seen right after pouring and when swirling in the snifter with thick fingers of liquid clinging the sides of the glass before slowly fading to the base of the beer at the bottom of the snifter.

 Smell  The aroma of the beer has tons of chocolate and coffee in the nose. Along with these smells are some wonderful oaky and bourbon aromas mixed with a good dose of caramel and vanilla sweetness. Some other lighter aromas of a more dark fruit nature are thee as well with smells of cherry, raisin and plum all there. Overall the aroma is big roasty and sweet producing a nice warming aroma overall.. 

 Taste  The taste begins with a massive level of roasty malt and sweet chocolate with a huge sweet caramel and vanilla flavor. Even from the start some bourbon and oaky flavors are detected on the tongue. While very sweet upfront, the beer incredibly gets even sweeter as the caramel ramps up and is joined by some brown sugar and a toffee sweetness with other flavors of lighter dark fruits of fig and raisin (light in comparison to sugar flavors; although by no means light). The roastedness and chocolate flavors fade a tad at the increase of the sweet. Some coffee comes to the tongue however and just like the sweeter flavors, the booziness and bourbon flavors get quite a bit stronger in nature as well. These transitions, with the massive increases in the sweetness and the booziness, all in the end, leave a big, massively sweet and moderately boozy warming taste to linger on the tongue. 

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the thicker and creamier side with a carbonation level that is on the lower side. Both were fantastic for the darker flavors of the brew as well as for the huge sweet and alcohol flavors of the brew with the lower carbonation only accentuating these. With its boozy and oaky flavors in conjunction with the sweet and dark flavors of the brew the overall thick body and lower carbonation really make this one a nice warming brew and a nice slow drinker. 

 Overall  Big, robust, massively sweet, and warming. This is a nice imperial stout. A little sweeter then I would want on any real occasion, but this one makes a dessert all in itself, being quite nice for a capper to an evening after dinner on a cooler winter night.

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2014 "another big, expensive, and super good beer from Firestone Walker...though i didnt like this one quite as much as Black Xantus or 13. Props to FW, They sure know how to barrel a beer. What this one seemed to lack in complexity, it made up for in straight up yuminess. chocolate, vanilla, and bourbon were the main players and the oatmeal stout was super smooth. showed a little of the alcohol but it melded seamlessly with the big flavors."No longer below Black Xantus as of 2013-2014 (significantly better) and just kicked another 4.5 beers arse (BA Narwhal) in a head to head.

Poured a dark thick black with instant aroma of bourbon. Heavy oak, bourbon, and tobacco smell. Thick sticky viscosity. Instant flavor of dark chocolate that lasts and lasts. Some nuttiness as well. Not as big of a bourbon taste. This guy is very well balanced and very delicious.

Medium brown, not much head, very toasty, almost marshmallowy nose is pretty intense, bringing waves of dark malt and boozy richness. Very rich palate, stacks of vanilla, biltong, alcohol, prunes, burnt sugars...complex and intense, a nerd favourite.

2014 bottle pours dark brownish black with a small tan head. Aroma is molasses, oak, oats and bourbon. Taste is rich, sweet roast malts and oats with hints of chocolate, tobacco, bourbon, oak and smoke. Boozy but very good Impy stout.

Excelente Imperial Stout barrel-aged! Cor escura, licorosa, com pouca formação de espuma. Aroma de café, chocolate amargo, tabaco, bourbon, baunilha. Complexo. Na boca, desce aveludada, repetindo as notas do aroma. Final longo, com álcool aquecedor, bem inserido. Excelente breja!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2013. Nose is vanilla, prune, tobacco, oak, black strap molasses. Flavor is prune, oak, small amount of cacao, oat. Off dry. Very rich and creamy.
UPDATED: JUL 27, 2016 Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, dark chocolate, oak, and vanilla.

Bottle purchased Julios Liquor in 2012. Aroma is just elegant. Sweet subtle bourbon, molasses, brown sugar, roasted malt, bourbon vanilla and dark fruit. Makes me want to chug this beautiful beast. 
Flavor is up with some of the best Imperial stouts I have ever had. Should I spew the countless flavors I taste here? Bourbon is a light smooth undertone throughout the sip. Toasted oak upfront with vanilla, light sugar, caramel and lingering mellow roasted chocolate malts. Absolutely smooth and aged to near perfection. Hot damn, nice way to celebrate my #3000 rating. Shared with three friends.

2012 bottle, aged two yrs. Pours dark with a khaki colored foam head. The aroma is of sweet toasted malts, burnt carmel, mild sweet bourbon booze scents, soft oak aroma, and vanilla. In the flavor I enjoyed the body and balancing of flavors. I noticed sweet malts, sweet bourbon, mild to medium booze intensity, sugary sweetner, soft bitter dark malts, chocolate, and vanilla. The finish is roasty, boozy, light bitterness that fades, and lasting sweetness that is not overbearing. Overall this was a damn fine brew. I doubt that I could age another one of these a few yrs.

On tap, dark brown pour with small beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, oak and bourbon. Taste of roasted malts, dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla, slight coffee, oak, and bourbon. Full bodied, creamy mouthfeel, well balanced. Long bourbon finish that lasts forever.

Incredible. Pours very dark. Full bodied, thick, slightly oily and so full of flavor you have no choice but to sip. Dark malt, tobacco, molasses, hint of sweetness, chocolate, nothing burnt. Some fruits, hint of coconut and booze. A little of everything really. Quite well blended and smooth. One sip and you practically taste forever.

UPDATED: MAY 10, 2016 (Firestone Walker Parabola) Bottle 650 ml at home from rouhlas, many thanks!Vintage 2013, served into a snifter, ABV 13%
Black coloured body with a full finger of dark brown head on top, with very good retention.
Aroma is full of chocolate, vanilla, alcohol, wood, faint bourbon. 
More bourbon on the taste, vanilla, notable alcohol, again lots of dark and milky chocolate, mocha, wood,light roasted malts on the finish.
Full body with good carbonation, sticky but smooth on the palate.
Great beer.


Original rating 20/7/14.Taster at Zeebra II.
Pours totally black with a thin dark brown head on top. Good retention, renews itself with every swirl of the glass and leaves light lacing behind. 
Aroma of a good matured whiskey, burned wood, rye. 
Taste of dark chocolate, roasted malts, light bourbon, wood, a touch of smoke, alcohol. Nice bitterness on the aftertaste, and coffee notes with a roasted character. 
Full body with a smooth texture, good levels of carbonation. Sticky palate. 
Great beer, hopefully I will soon have a whole bottle of this one.

2014 vintage bomber. Pours black with a large light brown head. Aroma of bourbon, sweet dark malt, chocolate, tobacco and hints of molasses. Taste of dark chocolate, sweet malts, bourbon, molasses, tobacco and mild charr. Boozy.

2012 bottle aged at 55-60º

A mahogany pour leads to a black body with fiery auburn highlights, topped by a quickly fading half inch frothy dark khaki head creating extended thin horizontal peninsulas of lace, spots and thin peninsulas of alcohol decorate the snifter

Big, yet controlled notes of juicy bourbon and silky dark milk chocolate lead the way blending flawlessly into mingling, morphing layers of dates, cherry pie, cola, coffee, coconut, almond, toffee, toasted marshmallow, banana split... all on a slightly sticky, oily smooth, coating medium plus body, flavors evolving into treacle and vanilla on the finish with spirit warmth lightly drying and cleaning to reveal residuals echoing all the flavors and aromas, at this age the sweetness is perfectly articulated by all the drying, lean components, my brain is tingling, exceptional stout

Solid intensity, deep complexity, flawless transitions, everything a barrel aged stout should be, can the 2012 batch get any better?

22oz served at 55º and warming into Orrefors Difference Porter snifter

Flaske, købt for 250 kr i Mikkeler & Friends - og heldigvis god. Mørk, tæt, sort-brun, masser af tekstur og en flot, tyk, holdbar, cremet beige skum-krone. Rosiner i rom.. Sød wiener melange. Vanilie parfait. Let eg. Sveskemos. Kaffe. Choko. Balance. Zen.

Pours jet black with a nice oaky aroma. The body is thick almost syrupy but the flavors are bold. Strong notes of chocolate, oak, and vanilla. Finishes very smooth with the flavors lingering for a while. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bomber aged since 2012. Pours a deep dark brown with minimal chestnut foam. Big bourbon notes with heavy vanilla and alcohol scent. Heavy vanilla and caramel at first, finishes sweet with plenty of alcohol burn. One word: Amazing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 vintage to snifter. Holy shit! Loves up to the hype. Pour is black as night. Aroma is German chocolate cake and booze. Taste is chocolate, vanilla, coconut, oak, booze, and coffee. Finish is super slick and a bit warm. Incredible beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sounds weird, but it just smells smooth. Oak, roasted malt, coffee, tobacco, chocolate...it is all well balanced and definitely doesn?t some across hot considering the abv. Really impressive.
Bottle. 2012. Soy sauce. Opaque black body. Tastes far better than it smells. Rich, milk chocolate with some malt in the finish. Really unbelievably outstanding and doesnt taste as strong as it is.
Taste from a bottle at FyneFest. Very smooth. Caramel flavours. Really good one, like it.

Russian Imperials are all pretty delicious, but this is a complex, flavorful new factories (along with Ten Fidy. Speaking of which, I'm drinking this at OB for my rehearsal dinner. Thanks for getting the tab, Mom and Dad!). 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 8, 2014 22 oz bottle. Pours an opaque pitch black. Beige head is lasting with minimal lacing. Aroma is roasted malt, prominent bourbon aroma. Flavor is absolutely fabulous. This is the ideal flavor and complexity for a barrel aged stout. The standard for all other stouts to be measured.

2011 vintage opened with Huhzubendah. Perfection.

2012 Vintage Jet black ink in appearance with whispy cream head clouds
Nose is oak, campfire, and sweet raisins. Taste is suprisingly nice, charred oak followed by a mild achohol burn, slight chocolate aftertaste.

Draught at Oscar Blues. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with chocolate, nuts, coffee, licorice, hops, vanilla and roasted malts. Bitter finish with coffee, vanilla, roasted malts and licorice. Magnificent imperial stout.
Bottle at RBNG-14. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, alcokol. Flavour is vanilla, malt, hop, licorice, coffee, chocolate. Full body. Very nice beer.

Pours dark black with a perfect tan colored one finger head. Aroma of bourbon. Taste is bourbon sweet malt, toffee and espresso. Palate is super silky with the perfect carbonation. Excellent bba stout!

From a 0.65l bottle @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Been searching a while for this little treat and finally, my turn! It pours a deep dark brown, not directly black but more dark brown body with a small sidesticking light brown top. Not to much aroma at first, but leaving it in the glass for a while, it really starts to push out some lovely licorice and dark roasted coffee! Chocolate is also present. A thing that reminds me of sea salt also hits the nose after a while in the glass, whisky perhaps? Really nice. Loaded with flavors! The licorice is just out of this world delicious! Almost like candy.. Dark chocolate, perfectly roasted on the malty side with a little bit of sweet and gently warming alcohol. Damn this is tasty! Salty finish with loads of licorice in the aftertaste. Could easy drink this all day/night long. 03.05.2013

Pitch black with thin mocha head and frothy lacing. Nose was dominated by vanilla, chocolate and a sweet, oaky bourbon. A lot of caramel malts and roast. Mouth also had a decent amount of bourbon, but it blended well with a lot of vanilla, coffee, caramel and anise. A slightly dry, bitter finish that lingered for a bit.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Tap @ CBC. Pours black with a small and shortlasting mochabrown head. Aroma is very complex. Chocolate, coffee, brownie dough, vanilla, licorice, roasted malt, dates and raisins. Woody and earthy aswell alongside of a sweet toffee-caramel bourbon side. Taste is sweet with a nice roastedness and bitter aftertaste. 

Rerated 11/09/2014. Bottle shared with vestergaard and rasmusott. Trade from preismj. Pours pitch black with a medium light brown/offwhite head. Aromas of slight bourbon, stale, coffee, hay, marshmallow, almost minty licorice, dates and some slightly roasted malts. Taste is sweet bourbon notes up front, coffee roast, some dark bittersweet chocolate, leather, once again the slightly roasted malts, almost giving it some grain-like notes. Some toffee and very rich and smooth alcohol. 

A: 8, Ap: 4, T: 9, P: 5, O: 18. Total: 4.4.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours black, chocolate, coffee, liquorice, bitter, light vanilla.

Amazing blend of flavors when it gets to you palette even with the aroma that is a sweet chocolate. The abs is not too well hidden but everything else makes up for it. Sipped this puppy and if a desert person this will pair very well. can see why this has great ratings

Bottle from Sean and wob cap hill. Aroma is aged oak and vanilla, with sweet pipe tabacco. Opaque black, almost no head. Bourbon barrel flavor is intense yet mellow. Oaky, vanilla, chocolate, spicy cinnamon, and alcohol. Finish is tingly sweet spiced and lingers deep vanilla and bourbon. Overall sneaky strong, super sip able, bourbon barrel roasted stout.
This is by far one of the best stouts I have ever tried. Bourbon up front, lots of toasted notes with carmel and dark fruits. What an amazing beer.

2014 Parabola

AROMA: Chocolate, vanilla, bourbon, booze, tobacco, slight coffee, slight caramel, smells amazing!

APPEARANCE: Pitch black, leaves a small espresso like head on a heavy pour, exactly how a stout should look like!

TASTE: Follows the nose exactly, the booze is minimal in the taste, its just enough to get it some warmth and lively character

PALATE: Thick, oily, slightly syrupy, and creamy

OVERALL: Fantastic stout, one of the best and especially for the price!

Jet black pour with a tan head. Aromas of bourbon barrels, pipe tobacco, cocoa, and dark fruit. Flavor is big dark chocolate with notes of molasses and anise. Very complex. Finish is rich and robust with slight warming from the abv. Delicious brew.

Pours a very dark black, no head. Aroma is really special. Vanilla, sweet bourbon, oak, a strong woodiness, chocolate, dark fruits, tobacco?, some caramel... Taste is bourbon up front, vanilla, sweet chocolate, raisin, coffee... Just wonderfully complex. Its really sweet. Full body, dry finish, great stout. Looking forward to seeing how this ages.

Dark malty, almost more sweet than roasted in this sample, some choc, dark fruity, wooden boozy notes, pretty decent (D12)

Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. 1st Session. Pours black with a beige head, aroma of bourbon, wood, coconut, malt and chocolate, flavor of coconut, malt, wood, chocolate and alcohol, medium to full bodied. nice
Poured jet black with little to no head. Lots of oak and bourbon on the nose. Not very hot for 14%. Choc and bourbon on the tongue. Lingering vanilla and brown sugar after taste.

what a wonderful beer. had at the brewery on tap and out of the bottle. has a dark fruit and bourbon nose to it,very complex and enjoyable. when i saw the abv imagined it would hard to hide the alcohol but they did it. 
 the taste is similar to the nose but add in the barrel flavor and this beer becomes one of the best beers i have had

Bomber. Pours opaque coffee with thin tan head. Smells of molasses, maple, and alcohol. Drinks with a moderate alcoholic bite and mild lingering bitterness. Full bodied. Tastes of molasses, wood, maple vanilla bourbon, coffee and toffee. Complex. Finishes with a warming sensation.
Black with light brown head - Sweet malt aroma - A very good sweet malt body with some coffee and licorice - Lasting sweet malt finish - This was extremely good

Pours dark black with a small tan head. Smell is not super appealing to me and is very soy sauce like with dark fruit, figgy, aromas next followed to a lesser extent with some vanilla and some bourbon, but im not getting any roasted malt or coffee or tobacco or charred oak whatsoever which were the exact things I like in BA Imperial Stouts. Taste is dark chocolate, slight bourbon and a faint amount of alcohol peeks through. Sweeter side of imperial stouts, but still balanced enough. Oily mouthfeel with soft but lightly prickly carbonation. 
I really didnt like the way this smelled, and while the taste was much better and its a very nicely made beer, overall it just does not justify the price to me at $20 a bottle here, and there are others I prefer as far as Barrel Aged Imperial Stouts go.

On tap rock chocolate and coffee taste with high alcohol.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap cbc14. Pours dark brown with small off-white head. Aroma is a lot of dried fruits, dark chocolate, roasty and some alcohol. Taste is sweet and fresh. Plums and dates. Dark chocolate. Finish is dry bitter and roasty mouthfeel. Nice job.
chocolate, brown, clear, medium bitterness, light sweetness, full body, lively,
Backnote, had this beer at the zeebra extreem beer festival 2014. superb beer, really looked foreward to trying this
At CBC. Black colour with tan head. Wood, roasted aroma. Wood, sweet, vanilla, roasyed and chocolate taste. Full body.

Nice mix, balances well between dark chocolate roast and barrel. Chocolate a little on sweet side. Barrel evident but not totally overpowering. Some smoke, light coffee. Pours black with decent head and lacing. Tap at Churchkey tap takeover.

Small sample from bottle @ Zeebra II. Pours pitch black with a small tan head. Aroma is sweet with licorice, tar, molasses and some roasted malts. Taste has roasted malts, dark chocolate, bourbon, alcohol and a medium bitter finish. Full body, soft carbo.
Tasty and solid imperial stout, just how I like em. Dark roasted malt and with an oaky touch.

Pours dark deep brown with a slightly frothy tan head. Nose picks up a strong plum and fig with a little rum undertone. Taste is a rich bouquet of rye and bourbon. It is a heavy beer at 13% yet there was only a slight alcohol taste but it doesnt detract from the experience in the least. i took a point off of the palate because it was a little oily in the mouth feel.
Pours a dark brown beer with a tan bubbling head. Smells rye, bourbon. Tastes bit spicey, bourbon, vanilla, roasted. Low carbo, medium body and a oily texture.
Zwarte kleur met een goede lichtbruine kleur kraag. Ruikt vanille, crème en gebrand. Smaakt vol, vanille, gebrand en koffie. Iets creamy. Goede bittere en zware nasmaak.

22 ounce bottle (2014, 14% ABV) poured into a Belgian snifter. Pours jet black with half a finger of tan head, more of a ring. Fades to a super thin ring around the glass. Aromas of bourbon, coconut, vanilla, dark fruit, caramel, milk chocolate. Really fantastic aroma. Tasting notes of bourbon, dark chocolate, vanilla, a bit of coconut, subtle dark fruit, roast, oak. Full body with a dry and slightly warm finish. Thick oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation. Definitely one of my favorite bourbon barrel aged imperial stouts.

Also popped my year old 2013 vintage (13% ABV) on 5/2/2014. More dark fruit, roast, licorice. Bourbon is subdued. Prefer this fresh.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Tap at CBC 2014. Pours transparent reddish brown. Lovely thick light Brown head. Aroma has lots of licorice, chocolate and Grown ups candy. Really delicious and exclusive. Complex barrel notes, licorice, perfect roast. Extremely good beer! (9/5/9/5/17)

Rerate from bottle: Has got a more of a bitter roast than i recall. Besides that, it has a non-roasted malty side to it as well. Very smooth body over all. New rating would is 8/5/9/5/17

Bottle. Black oil, heavy. Aroma is dark roast malt, bourbon, and brown sugar. The taste adds dark chocolate, oak, molasses, and spice. The palate is rich and heavy. The high abv of 14% is hidden very well in the complexity of this big brew but, it provides a perfect warm note on the finish. Overall, one of the best barrel aged imperial stouts. Full-bodied and balanced

On tap at Firestone. Appearance: light brown film of head, dark brown color, cloudy. Aroma: raisin, bourbon, oak, light roastiness. Palate: full body, smooth, alcoholic texture, oily. Taste: sweet throughout with a light bitter hoppiness at the end. Overall, very very smooth beer, hops are a nice contrast to the smooth malty sweetness. Very good.

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Sampled at Boises Imperial Stout get together, over 120 bottles to choose from. Going with the flow on this rating. Sampled again at Alefort, 2015 vintage.Very smooth and silky, chocolate, molasses, wood and mild burn. Extremely tasty.

Pours pitch black with a tight tan head and laces slightly. Bold massive nose, dark fruits, figs, brown sugar, alcohol. Mind blowingly great mouth feel, sweet, warm, coats the mouth in total. Great flavors and massive long loving finish. Amazing beer.

Out of the bottle at Bangers in Austin, TX -- I drank this, but cannot effectively rate this due to the fact that after the first two sips/gulps I dont remember anything (due to Parabolas inherent high ABV or my dehydrated, "Im okay" state). Would like to try again but for what I can remember this was an impressive beer, including but despite its price tag.

A - 4/5 - dark brown/black beer w a mocha head that fades quick due to the abv. Looks like motor oil.
S/aroma - 10/10 - bourbon, oak, smoke, dark chocolate, espresso
Taste - 10/10 - super smooth, chocolate, coffee, oak, bourbon, smokiness, roasted malts, nice barrel flavors, caramel. Coconut.
 Palate - 5/5- super thick, alc covered, aftertaste - coffee, bourbon, roasted malts, smoke, oak/bourbon barrels. 
O - 19/20 - the best BA imperial stout Ive had. Supposedly the best of the batches so far. I dont have a basis for comparison but Id believe it.

2011 bottle at tap n handle. Pours a deep brown color with a small tan head. Aroma is oak, bourbon, molasses, chocolate, tobacco. Flavor is dark fruits, spices, bourbon, wood. Pretty boozy as well. Huge flavorful beer.

4/20/2014 in fort Collins. Weed was legalized this year and for 420 I came put after eating some weed cookies and to cap off a day of drinking I found a parabola 2011 in bottle. Bought. Gets better with every sip. Nose is Bourbon and chocolate and booze. Mouth feel is smooth. Chocolate coffee taste.

Poured from tap to glass. Jet black hue with light brown creamy head that lingered. Aroma is huge with essences of roasted malt, caramel, plums, oak, cherries, chocolate, leather. Mouthfeel is fantastic with a full body and good carbonation. Taste is sweet initially with a nice astringent following and smooth ethanol heat throughout the finish. Overall this is an absolutely fantastic brew!
2013 bottle pours black with low tan head. Aroma is rich roast and bourbon chocolate, taste is similar with a great smooth roast and bourbon finish, no alcohol heat
2012 bottle. Roasty coffe nose, mile soy sauce. I need to get a fresh bottle.

2012 Bottling.
Aroma: Boozy, Licorice, Bourbon

Appearance: Dark Opaque Hue, Passes No Light, Brown Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

Taste: Licorice, Boozy, Smoked Dark Malts

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Medium to Full Bodied, Mildly Smokey, Mildly Boozy
Wow is this good. The word on the 2014 vintage is vanilla. Its what Im getting in spades. Nary a hint of booziness or alcohol heat, and yet were talking 14% ABV. Wow wow wow.

Alcohol, sweet, candy licorice, hint of chocolate smell, light brown head, dark as night look. There is a reason why this stout is rated so high, it seems like most of the stouts you try are too bitter or too sweet or too coffee based, but this one is a perfect blend of everything. It is so smooth going down, its like drinking a soda. Incredible!!! I just drank the 2004 14% bottle and let me tell you something you wouldnt know it was 14%.
Another release of one of the best bourbon imperial stout. Smooth, bourbon with a hint of licorice.

Got around to trying the 2014 tonight, and my first thought was that this is way better than I remember last years being. And I loved Parabola last year. Quite dark and opaque. The nose is surprisingly subdued for such a big beer, but butterscotch is mostly what comes to mind. Taste is exquisite. Seemed a little boozy my first few sips, but once my palette adjusted I didnt want to change a thing.
A very complex stout with a high abv - nice notes of bourbon, dark fruits, chocolate. Nice dark pour with small tanish head..

Parabola - Firestone Walker 
Russian Imperial Stout
14% ABV

APPEARANCE: Pours a deep shadow black from a bright sunny day. Slight dark chiclayo rim variation. With a pillowy, creamy mocha head. 

AROMA: Ginger bread pudding topped with coconut ice cream drizzled with a bourbon caramel sauce. Hints of raisins, and heat from the high ABV. 

TASTE: Sexy and seducing layers that evolve in your mouth. Chocolate, leather, tobacco amazingly balanced with raisins molasses and bright oaky flavors. So delicious, just letting it roll back and forth getting more and more flavors each second. 

MOUTHFEEL: medium body with vivacious and enthusiastic carbonation that dances in your mouth. Some heat from the 14% ABV, that ends with a nice long finish that leaves the mouth coated in a oily sweetness. 

OVERALL: Very easy drinking and amazing flavor profile. Up until now the bcs has been the top of my stout list, this may have just knocked it off!

RATING: 5/5 Zombie Heads!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 Bottle 2013 edition at the Hoppy Pub Thessaloniki. Pours Black really dark with a thin dark brown head that doesnt lasts for long. Looks great. Great bourbon aromas with vanilla and chocolate on, and some wood and roasted malts. Full chocolate , coffee flavors and vanilla, bourbon from the aging. Wood, dark fruit and roasted malts are here too, to give me a great pleasure. Full bodied and smooth mouth feel. Long dry aftertaste of milk chocolate and bourbon. Amazing beer. A real brew gem !

2014 bottle- Silky espresso, dark chocolate, bourbon, oak, vanilla aromas. Pours a thick dense midnight with a finger layer of caramelized sugar foam cap. Chocolate cake, bourbon, oak, tannin, caramel, raisin flavors. Full body, good mouthfeel delicious stuff.

Draught. Pours a thick and near-black color with a very small tan head on it. Taste is slightly boozy, but still inviting, with a fair amount of roasting and a lot of chocolate to it. Taste is very chocolatey and roasty with just a hint of whiskey in there. Very smooth, and yummy as hell. Awesome brew.

2012 vintage. Decadent. Tons of roasted malt, but still not very bitter - the sweeter notes of chocolate and vanilla mostly overpower the bitterness. The alcohol is masked pretty well. One of the better imperial stouts that Ive had.

15.02.2014. 0,65l Bottle. RBNG-14. Dark brown colour with white head. Dark malts. Very solid rich aromas of everything you want in a beer; Dark malts and whisky! Strong and rich. Notes of vanilla and strong bourbon notes. Very good. I relly like this kind of beer.

2013 edition, labelled "Proprietors Reserve Series #004". Poured opaque inky black with a 1-finger dark tan head that disappeared quickly. Aromas of coffee and wood, with a note of leather beneath. Full body, lightly oily with a mild astringency to the finish. Flavor of coffee with wood notes and a light charred note. Some leather at the back, and maybe some cherry as it warms.

2012 vintage. Pours black with tan head that rims the tulip glass. Nose is chocolate vanilla bourbon barrel nose. Sweet vanilla flavor, smooth blend of bourbon and some earthy tobacco leaf. Slight alchy burn. Heavy body. Great but this shouldnt be the pain it is to get a bottle.
2013, poured a dark brown with tan head. Smell of bourbon and oak. Flavor of chocolate, molasses, brown sugar. Well balanced
A very complex stout. High Abv. Heavy on the bourbon, dark fruits, chocolate, etc. overwhelming, but great.

A big thanks to kathouse in Vegas for this beauty. Pours black with with creamy white head which doesnt last long... but its still a beautiful looking beer in its own right. Aromas of bourbon and vanilla, toast, and awesome milk chocolate. Flavors are toasty malts and bitter chocolate with a great boozy finish. Awesome stuff.

Thanks cards04 for this one. Dark black with off white, doesnt last too long, but fairly attractive beer. Milky lactose and bit of acid on the aroma. Taste is chocolate, fruit, a bit of nuttiness and oak, definitely sweet bourbon and booze. Nice imperial stout.
Bottle pour in December. Lots of tobacco and smoke with sweet chocolate flavors. A near perfect bear!

Bottle. Black body with small not very long lasting brown head. Wonderful aroma of coffee, cocoa, vanilla and dried fruits. Taste is roasted malts bourbon some vanilla some dried fruits some coffee some cocoa. Aftertaste is very bitter with vanilla and cocoa and also some alcohol. Great and complex one but I think its a little bit too bitter.

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2015 Re-rate. Bomber. Clear Reddish dark brown with a creamy, tan head that lasts and laces. Aromas of dark fruit, raisin, plum, chocolate, roasted malt, bourbon, vanilla, and caramel. Flavor is chocolate, raisin, light caramel, roasted malt, plum, black cherry, vanilla and bourbon. Full bodied, thick and creamy, smooth with a roasty, dry end. Some heat as well.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2014 Bottle at Brewsters bar at four points sheraton, Los Angeles. Black oil, minimum head. Aroma is big bourbon character on the nose. Taste is very winey (rich dark fruits without tang) alongside bourbon. Almost spirit like. Lots in the mix here. Bourbon is very present though. Fruitiness gives the beer a pudding quality like no other stout Ive had. Soft to moderate carbonation. Not a chewy body. Sweetness on finish without being sticky. Finish - mild roast bitterness. Barrel plays major role here. Like a super charged Hargreaves Hill double barrel stout or cockswains but with more going on. Maybe a little too sweet and syrupy for me. Wish it was also a bit more full bodied as feel rich flavours would benefit even more from this.

Superb and one of the best imperial stouts Ive had. Pitch black with a thin bronze head. Aroma of roasted malts, bourbon, oak and hops. It smelled rich. Oily and full palate without being like syrup. An explosion of balanced and rich flavors. Along with the aromas there was some vanilla and coffee.
Maybe chocolate. So much going on and it went too quickly.

750ml bottle given to me by ck1, and cellar aged more than 18 months - served at cellar temperature and shared on Thousandth Night with ck1 and Jan. Number 1001! Pours an opaque black with a brown head leaving almost no lace. Aroma has vanilla, grapes and dark chocolate with some caramel showing up. Rich and decadent. Taste is of bakers chocolate, bourbon, heavy roast and grapes on a heavy caramel malt base. Full bodied and super smooth - even smoother than Barrel Aged Rasputin - with alcohol. Finishes smoothly bitter and sweet, with chocolate and roast ... and vanilla-y bourbon. This was a terrific, terrific brew! Easy to see as the base of the FW anniversary ales.

Refrigerated 2012 brown bomber poured into a snifter. Pours black with dark brown highlights. Aroma is big bourbon, medium/thick body, medium carbonation, and some thin small bubble lacing. Taste is intense bourbon, roasted malt, oak, some dark chocolate, some vanilla, balancing hop backbone, and slightly bitter slightly dry finish. Very good imperial stout.

Sampled from a big bottle at the Grand Tasting at the RBNG-event at Fredrik 3.s Hall. Low, tan-coloured head. Devil-black body. Mid-sweet dark malty nose with hints of bourbon. More bourbon to the taste buds joined by vanilla and caramel balanced by a nice half-dry, bitter finish. Oily palate. Velvety mouthfeel. Excellent sipper (Fredriksten festning, Halden 15.02.2014).

Sinful black color with a nice beige head. Lovely aroma. Vanilla, oak and chocolate. Full body. Well hidden alcohol. Espresso, chocolate, vanilla and oak in the flavor. Yummi! [Bottle at Grand Tasting RBNG14  Halden]
The beer that started it all... Absolutely delicious. Dark, flavorful, perfectly smooth.

From a shared 65cl bottle at RBNG-14. Pours very dark, close to black, with an off-white head. Lovely wooden aromas, vanilla, dark malts, chocolate and caramel. Sweet and smooth as hell with a slightly dry and lightly bitter finish. Delicious stuff! (2014-02-15 - Grand Tasting, Fredriksten festning, Halden)

Near black body, under a thin layer of tan cream head. Intense and rich malt aroma resembling burnt caramel/brown sugar, dark chocolate, burnt wood, bourbon and dark dried fruits. Thick and mouth-coating. Full body. Taste mirrors the aroma. Big and flavorfull malt base with balancing bittering hops, and a pleasant alcohol warmth in the finish. A great and complex IS. [Shared bottle at Grand Tasting, RBNG2014]

Bottle @tasting. Pours black with a tan head. Nose of coffee some sweetness, chocolate and caramel with an almost, "is it there? Yes, it is," hint of tobacco. Vanilla on the palate, fruity and caramel, would have loved to have had this with a dessert.

Pours a thick black color with a finger of khaki foam. The nose is great with layers of bakers chocolate, tobacco, burnt sugar, vanilla, bourbon and charred wood. The palate follows the nose with a sliky mouthfeel and tons of flavors that somehow balance each other out into a beautiful stout. Nothing sticks out as too much and nothing leaves you wishing there was more... just a plain old great beer that needs to be drank rather than read about , More PLEASE !

22oz bottle (2012 vintage) shared thanks to Lukaduke! Pours dark creamy black-brown with small dark brown head. Nose is fruity bourbon and roasty coffee bean, dark chocolate. Taste is rich creamy coffee, dark chocolate, mocha, cream, vanilla. Finish is bitter roasty mocha and coffee with very well balanced bourbon fruitiness and just a touch of heat. Fantastic!

03.05.2013, 0,65l bottle sampled @ CBC:
Fyldig sødmerik lukt med preg av mørk malt, bourbon, sjokolade, karamell, vanilje, mørkt sukker, kakao, litt tre. Tørr lett sødmerik smak med preg av mørk malt, tre, mørkt sukker, kakao, gras, bourbon, vanilje, sjokolade. Middels bitterhet som set godt. Veldig god.

UPDATED: MAR 25, 2014 2013 bomber poured into a sexual chocolate teku. thanks to axnjxn over at BA for the bottle trade!

pours a dark brown on the edge of black, finger-width cafe au lait head that dissipates quickly leaving next to no lacing. nose is bourbon without the boozy burn, some oak and vanilla, a whisper of caramel. not getting much in the way of chocolate in the aroma. taste is mellow bourbon and cocoa up front, giving way to roast and charred wood. moderate carbonation and a slight back-end burn that gives the lie to the 13% abv, some coating and lingering roastiness. overall a fantastic bbl imperial stout. if bcbs is your nearest comparison, this is more roasty where bcbs is sweet.
Great, dark malty beer, the ABV comes through a little which is okay considering how robust this beer is. The Walker does it again with another solid beer.

At RBNG 2014 Halden. Black color, good offwhite foam . Immediate high intensity aromas of malt, choclate, leather & some dried fruits. Full body & high complexity . Some bitterness, but on the sweet side. Very powerful & Very enjoyable beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2013 vintage on tap at Whole Foods. Pours a thick black color without much head. Sweet complex flavors with a mild bourbon barrel taste. Slight toffee notes. So mild.
A little too bourbony for me. Burnt coffee eww. Dark beer. Another Firestone disappointment for me.

Bottle at Craigs. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aromas of liquorice, vanilla and tobacco. Taste has lots of coconut and vanilla, chocolate and more licorice. Quite a sweet taste, but a clean finish clean. Very nice.

Part of a special "barrel" week at The Beer Junction. $3.60 for a 4oz pour, listed as 13.0% ABV. Opaque, black color with a tan head. Aroma was roasty (borderline burnt smell), picked up on the alcohol and bourbon. Flavor was really potent and bitter. It was thin and didnt leave any lace. Very strong bourbon aftertaste. This was part of a 4 beer sampler (all barrel aged) and I would say it came in 3rd. Definitely not bad and worth a try.
Bottle, batch one. Black woth tan head. Roasty licorice aroma woth chocolate and vanilla, oak. Taste has lots of cocobut and vanilla, chocklate and licorice. Sweet and clean. Excellent.

UPDATED: APR 7, 2016 2012 bottle from Tommy, thanks man! Black pour, not super thick and fudge like but pretty darn black once it hits the glass, some tan head but evaporates pretty quick and reappears every time I give my glass a little swirl. Aroma - I want my baby back baby back ribs...loads of bourbon, chocolate, alcohol, oak. Taste - oh man this is rich...caramel, vanilla, brown sugar all meld together upfront, towards the middle the stout rears its head, roasted malts, hops, finishes slightly boozy with a little bit of heat. Really great stuff!

On draught at Belmont Station for Bigger Badder Blacker Week. 2012 vintage. Deep black syrup in color with hints of amber. Aroma is bourbon, coconut, vanilla, and dark roasted malt. Taste is intense bourbon, vanilla, dark chocolate, toasted coconut, and oak. Pleasing syrupy mouthfeel and lingering full-spectrum aftertaste.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2014 Bottle: Many thanks to all whove sent me Parabola over the years. Extremely dark brown pour; black once it piles into the glass with a mocha head that plumes up & exhibits excellent retention, lasting for days. Aroma has lots & lots of mellow bourbon with a deep onset of oak, wood, & vanillin. Lots of sweet, creamy chocolate notes, more vanilla, mild roast, & warming booze in the finish... Smells like a molten mocha cake with bourbon. Taste is loaded with sweet bakers chocolate; dark, bittersweet, & backed with a creamy, fudge-like delicateness. Small pips of vanilla from the barrel hop in & out... Very dessert-y up front. Bourbon & oak move in softly but potently, warming the throat well into the finish. Aftertaste of bourbon, lots of wood, chocolate, faint roast, burnt-ass caramel, & even a hint of maple syrup. Cocoa & bourbon reign supreme, but this is still a super intricate beer. Amazing stuff.

Blind tasting between this and Alesmith Speedway. I dont think the barrel aging process goes particularly well with this one. The caramel sweetness that it imparts hinders, not helps, the inherent coffee and roasted nut flavor of an IS. Still fantastic and well made, compared to some of its contemporaries, this one is in the middle of the pack.

Thanks to pants678 for this one!
22oz bottle served in a Duvel tulip
Vintage 2013

A - Pours black with a thin mocha cap. The head settles down and vanishes while leaving thick legs down the glass.

S - Massive roasted malt aroma, rich bready malts, Amish chocolate bread, caramel/chocolate, big nutty yeast, toasted coconut, vanilla, toasted graham crackers, cherries and other dark fruits come out as it warms.

T - Roasted barley, sweetened espresso, bittersweet chocolate, molasses, nutty brown bread, strong coffee flavored with coconut syrup. The bourbon is light but rustic with a scorched butterscotch character. Dark fruit emerges as it warms. The alcohol

M - Medium full body when cold but once warm turns to light side of medium body, thin but silky feel, the consistency becomes more syrupy as it warms. Warming finish with some bite.

A big and bold flavored beer that is far from boring. The yeast was very strong and nutty creating a very bready flavor, which was a nice change for a RIS. I liked this one colder rather than warm. Once this warms up it becomes a thin syrupy alcohol bomb. The bourbon was there but delicate and didnt overpower the hefty malt bill. Nice fruit components but its hard to distinguish the type of fruits. Glad I got to try this one.

Drink this big boy cold.

Serving type: bottle

12-19-2013

UPDATED: APR 18, 2014 2010 Bottle at home, a touch moldy from the basement flood. I?ll be honest, my notes suck for this beer. We were just celebrating the fact that the basement was no longer flooded. It was a tasty reward and I?ve got more bottles to review later.

Have had maybe 15-20 times. Pours a very nice black coffee color with small head. Layered nose of sweet barrel, dark chocolate, vanilla, marshmallow cream, light Christmas spice. Deep, rich palate with flavors of mild heat, oak barrel, wet tobacco, dark chocolate, and spiced cookie. This is a beer that is sensitive to serving temperature, too cold and it shuts down. Also needs time in the glass to go from very good to great.

Bottle kindly shared by Cuso, thank you! 2013 edition. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate. Quite strong milky scent. Very dark brown colour. Taste is strong chocolate, milk. Roasted malt. Rather sweet, balanced in part by the alcohol sting. Toffee. Really smooth creamy mouthfeel, and easily drinkable. Alcohol showing, but pleasantly. Exceptional, very good. Rich and complex. Finish is long in duration, warm with woody notes.

I think this is my favorite style. I can't give any of them less than a four. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at the 15th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 07/16/2011. No. 002. Dark black body with a small frothy tan head. Sweet roasty and chocolate aroma. Rich chocolate and roast flavor. Full body with moderate carbonation.

Pours very dark brown with a small tan head. The aroma has cream, vanilla, cocoa, bourbon, smooth roast and some apple bitterness. The body is thick and smooth with a velvety feel and light carbonation. The flavor begins with smooth chocolate, vanilla, oak, anise, dark caramel, soy sauce and apples. The finish has a bit of spice (hops?) and some warming alcohol heat. Well done.
(bottle 2012 vintage) black with little tan head. Aroma of alcohol. Flavor was whiskey, roast malt, some chocolate.
Pours black thin head. Very chocolaty. Aromas if cocoa, cherries vanilla, bourbon. Very smooth, light carbonation. Gets better as you drink it. Nice Beer
Poured a dark stout brown color from the bottle with aromas of roast, chocolate and bourbon. Flavors follow suit with a touch of vanilla, a great barrel and stout and quite enjoyable.
Draft at a tasting event. From notes. Loads or coffee and chocolate with bourbon and dark fruits. Very good.

22 ounce 2012 bottle from Timfoolery, bourbon, cherry aroma, mild flavor, oaky finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours black with brown head. Taste has big roasted malts and lots of molasses. Great stout.

Bottle from bier-deluxe.de. Vintage 2013. Dark brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, milk chocolate, tobacco. Taste, roasted malt, caramel, nuts, bourbon, dark fruits, vanilla, wood. Sweet caramel alcoholic finish. Little bit too much on sweet side, but dont understand me wrong, still highly enjoyable beer.

Bottle by Cuso, many thanks! Great spicy aroma for me that comes from the tobacco aroma. It reminds a lot of cigars and I like that. No so bitter and dark chocolate like like other RISs. Dark chocolate, roasted malt, warming alcohol. Overall excellent!

Bottle, courtesy of Cuso, many thanks. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma is milk chocolate, toffee, caramel, hints of alcohol. Taste is bittersweet, milk chocolate, strong alcohol, bourbon, plums, chilli. Long bittersweet finish with hints of chilli.

New review: 05APR12
Vintage 2011, No. 002
Pours black with some tann on mocha foam that falls to a broken sheet in a couple minutes. Nose is complex - honey, molasses, marshmallow, bourbon, vanilla and some black cherry. Flavor is sweet with toasted and roasted malts, molasses, dates, raisin, bourbon, oak, vanilla and hints of graham. Body is a little thin for the style initially with higher carb than Id prefer, and a semi slick finish that resonates longer than Id anticipated. This beer was better this time around than previous excursions. I like the nose here, and I rarely am dissappointed with a FW nose. 3.5/4.5/4/3.5/4

Initial review on 11JUN11
Vintage 2011, Batch 2
A: Pours a black as night beer with ruby and honey hues as light passes thru. Less than single finger of head over the coarse of the pour. Spotty lacing. Scattered light tan patches on surface.
S: Honey, vanilla, molasses, fig. The other day when I had this, it didnt smell nearly as nice. This one is lively with layers of malt, oak, wood, charred marshmallow, black cherries. 
T: Dark chocolate, bing cherry, medium toast oak, hints of alcohol, vanilla. This is much different now than several days ago, I was not impressed then - now: yes. Resonating finish with molasses, warmth, raisin and cherry. Nice oaky flavor carries through the entire palate and into the finish well. Some maduro feeling to this flavor profile, particularly on the finish.
M: Medium body for the style with moderately high carbonation on the style IMO. Semi dry finish mends the former two notes and it seems this beer could use a little viscosity to help weave the beer. 
O: This is certainly a sipping beer, and an excellent one at that. Im glad I hopped across the street for a beer to drink in this hotel before hitting the airport. As noted above this beer has excellent olfactory and palate play, but I think the mouthfeel takes away from the excellence of the beer. I also think this beer has such dominent wood character, that this would benefit from a year or two laying down to help it all come together. Granted, I think the malts would eventually turn this one really, really sweet, so it could be a delicate balance. Great beer for an oily, slow-burning, dark cigar. Or some pipe tobacco. Mostly would want the smoke in the air, not to actually take in as it would interfere rather than compliment the beer. 4/4.5/4/3/4 - 4.0

Serving type: bottle

04-05-2012

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 Tap at Baileys Taproom, Portland. Colour is black with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dark chocolate, sweetness, hints of coffee, bourbon and roasted malts. Nice but too sweet for me and not fan of these bourbon imps.
Bottle 0.66l at home, Helsinki. Thanks to tiong. Colour is black with almost no head. Aromas and flavours Coffee, chocolate, oaky wood, sweetness, hints of bourbon and roasted malts. Points 3.4->3.9.

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2014 Darkish brown with a small beige head. Aroma is liquorice, molasses, mellow coffee, vanilla, marshmallow, caramel. Full bodied, slick mouthfeel, sweet, boozy & complex with a warming finish. Taste is dark chocolate, molasses, anise, vanilla, raisins, dates.

2011 22oz bottle thanks to WanderinCelt87, shared with my wife to celebrate her birthday, pours pitch black with a diminishing light brown head, a little bit of it lingers around for a while, the aroma pretty much punches you in the face with bourbon and chocolate, even with it being nearly 3 years old, the flavor has a ton of dark chocolate with some of the bourbon and vanilla notes showing as well, a little bit of burnt tobacco in the finish, the 12.5% isnt really hidden all that well, really warms up the belly, its good, but just doesnt completely blow me away like I was hoping for.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2014 2014 Batch - 4.1

Well color me impressed. I find this to be superior to the prior years of the beer. It is bigger, a wee bit more subdued in the sweetness with more prominence in the roasted malt character, and an ever prominent bourbon facade. Absolutely delightful.
___________________________

2013 Batch - 3.8
Astounding beer. Big bourbon in the nose. Hides the alcohol very well; mouthfeel is medium-full, with loads of vanilla, oak and bourbon. The malts are moderated by the bourbon and the vanilla extremely well.  Great balance, albeit too sweet for me.

Sampled at an ESBLS tasting. It poured an opaque, dark brown color with a tan head. The aroma was of dark chocolate, coffee and a hint of oak. The taste was of roasted malts, chocolate, coffee and a medium bitter finish more from the roast than hops. Very good.

22oz pour into crooked stave snifter. Pours surprisingly thin with a very thin, quickly dissipating tan head. Aroma is very bourbon forward with a hint if chocolate, malt and coffee follow up. Taste is booze forward with taste that follows aroma. Surprisingly thin mouthfeel. Great beer, but top ten? Meh
beige head that disappears quickly without lacing. coffee colour. aroma coffee, sweet and vanilla. taste like aroma. soft carbonation and medium body, quite dense mouthfeel.  bottle 75 cl

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2013 Big, bold aroma... oak, licorice, cocoa, molasses, Pitch black with lacy khaki head. Dry cocoa, warming alcohol heavy finish. Big and chewy,very complex with different flavors every sip.

This is amazing. Nice chocolate sweet aroma. Perfect velvet mouthfeel. Excellent flavor and aroma nice head as well. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Top notch brew. Glad I finally got to try it. Now I want more! 

Not as highly skilled as Bourbon County, but its in the conversation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy
