22oz bottle (2013). Strong bourbon and tobacco flavor. Oak, vanilla, caramel, warming alcohol, chocolate. Good sipper. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap @ Baileys Taproom, Portland, Sixth Anniversary Barrel Aged Fest. Pours black with almost no head at all. Aroma is roasted malts, oak and bourbon, as well as vanilla, liquorice and lots of dark fruits. Full creamy body with no carbonation. Flavour is tremendous, and with no evidence of the rather high ABV. Sweet burned malts with tobacco and vanilla, cocoa and chocolate, as well as coffee and molasses, with a nice long chocolatey bourbon finish. Absolutely fantastic!

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2014 ok.. where do i need to start with this. shared a bottle with 2 close friends. this was just amazing. by far the best beer i ever had. poured pitch black with a tan caramel coloured head. smell of bourbon, more bourbon and... some more bourbon. vanilla notes. the taste is just so great. first mouthfeel is like there is a verry small hint of coconut, coffee, raisins, caramel, some roasty chocolate, lot of bourbon. but not overwelming. and the mouthfeel on this beer is just so awesome! its so smooth and perfectly balanced. I would love to sip this beer every day!

Pours a deep dark brown almost black. Aroma is boozy
Roasty chocolate. Flavor much the same...grainy, chocolate, boozy, toffee,  very nice.

Bottle, pours a nice pitch black, nice and thick. Aroma is a bit of bourbony and woody notes lots of roasty. Taste is a nice creamy flavour stout. Lots of roasty some. Coffee, chocolate and vanillia notes. Overall pretty tasty stuff. Thanks for. The share jeff

22oz bottle from Bittermestupid (Thanks Greg!) enjoyable 12% beer, with no real burn, slight roast from the stout and definite tobacco leave dryness on the palate, hints of chocolate and touches of char really tie it together, a big manly beer. good stuff. though Im Ohio Homering by giving it .1 less than BA Sib. Night.
A wonderful beer. Creamy, rich, nice coffee background. Smooth. Little alcohol burn. Just great.

FROM NOTES: June 29, 12
Serving type: on draft at the Rose & Crown a 2012 Vintage. Poured into a little mason jar type glassware. 

A: Bourbon, vanilla, dark, rich fruits, very malty sweetness. Intoxicating -- I think Im in love... 
A: A very deep, dark, rich garnet/ruby mahogany as opposed to the sheer pitch blackness you see in a lot of imperial stouts. SEXY pour, not just a beautiful pour. 
T: Blows me away. Absolutely, ridiculously delicious. The perfect concert of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, molasses, figs, dates, dark raisins, and malt all woven together by the woody undertones. WITHOUT A DOUBT, this is one of the best beers I have EVER had. Its very complex, I suspect it to get even more complex as I pull each bottle from the cellar. 
P: IMHO, very near a perfect imperial stout. Parabola is silky smooth, rich, creamy and dangerously drinkable. I dont taste the 12.5% anywhere in this beer. This beer deserves EVERY bit of hype it has received. It is phenomenally crafted and I am incredibly lucky to try it (and even more lucky to have a g/f that bought me 6 extra to cellar!). I would drink/buy this at every opportunity and recommend that anyone else who loves world class barrel aged stouts to do the same. Simply amazing. Maybe the best ever --- no THE BEST EVER!!!

Dark, black with good head retention and a bit of lacing, this imperial stout has a complex aroma with accents of chocolate and caramel. Although 12.5% ABV, you can't taste the alcohol in the finish. The taste has strong hints of coffee, almost like espresso. A nice beer!

---Cheers until next time!
DMSR

2011 vintage- heavy on the palate, deep roastiness, chocolate, coconut, vanilla, cherry, tobacco, light-moderate oxidation. This is drinking pretty damn well with this much time on it...this might start to fall off with a couple more years

Bomber (2013 vintage). Pours a stouty opaque brown-clack, nice espresso colored head that had decent retention, solid lacing. Nose is coffee, tobacco, whiskey barrel and an off metallic note that I cant figure on (loses points there). Mouth is thick and oily, malty and chocolaty up front, mingling barrel booziness, with dried fruit (dates and raisins), then coffee bitterness kicks in, followed by dark roast and some sootiness. Warmth from th ABV noticeable in the finish. Decent, but Abacus is still my favorite BA brew from FSW.

Bomber bottle, 2013 vintage. Aroma is dark malt and some booze. Appearance is black with a little tan head. Taste starts with sweet, dark malt then turns boozy and dry. Palate is dry from the dark malt. Overall, a fantastic beer that was not overhyped at all. One of the best stouts i have ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample at SBWF 2013. Smell of dark malts, coffee and chocolate. Similar taste. Complex and very nice to sip at.
bomber shared by jprime. black with a tan head. pretty much impy stout perfection. one of the best ive had.

@ SBWF 2013: stor komplex och mörk smak. Mycket asfalt, stora arraktoner. Mycket gott. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bourbon och champinjon i doft. Får direkt flashbacks till DOS rare (trots att det är annat fat. intressant). Absolut världsklass. Dock oväntat tunn i kroppen. Stord bidrag från fatet i smakbilden. underbar

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2014 Bottle from Justin, thanks a lot!
2013 vintage, pours black with reddish hues at the edge of the glass. A light beige small head that dissipates quick.
Aroma has barrel and vinous notes, dark chocolate, sweetness, plums and slight alcohol.
Dark chocolate, pumpernickel bread, nougat, almost burnt malt, cocoa powder, espresso coffee, hop bitterness, chocolate pudding, cherries and slight alcohol heat. Wow!
Thick and smooth with soft carbonation.
After taste is a bit short.
Wow. This is a near perfect beer. Great appearance n smell. One of my favorite brews. Must have

Bottled. Black. Dark roasty malts, but in a sutlte manner - not over-aggressive or anything. After tasting the firestone barley wine, this is a lot less characterful or intensive. Really good full, but drinkable, body. Sweet salty licorice. Roasted barley.

Appearance: Good, nice and dark. Looks more like coffee than beer, actually.
Smell: The smell is nice. Coffee-like. Also hints of chocolate.
Taste: Very rich taste. Hints of caramel, nuts, coffee, vanilla and also a very nice alcohol taste. Not too heavy, the balance is perfect.
Mouthfeel: my favorite part. Very well balanced. A sweet, thick beer. Very nice thickness.
Overall: awesome beer!

Bottle @ sbwf13. Poured black with a brown head. Wood, roasted malt, coffee aroma, lovely. Flavor has bread, nuts, spices, light alcohol, mostly warming. Intensive. Loong warming nutty, roasty finish. Superb.-- via beerbasher/winphone 7

Bottled. Dark brown in color, thin tan head. Bourbony oaky barrel notes, vanilla and roasted malts in aroma. Sweet malty, some roasted notes, oaky feel on the whole in taste. Vanilla sweetness, bourbon notes in the aftertaste. Incredible smooth taste that last for awhile. Nice.

I gave this beer a perfect score just for the rarity of it. Hard to come by here in Texas. This beer features bold bourbon and tobacco aromas and a rich dark chocolate, charred oak flavor. Parabola is best enjoyed in moderation and is a perfect beer to pair with those chocolate dessert favs. An extension of Quercus Alba —the Firestone Walker Barrel aged program. Russian Imperial Stout Aged in Bourbon Barrels.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A party in your mouth of dark chocolate, oak and bourbon. Don't miss the chance to savor this barrel aged imperial stout!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Danish pour @ a group tasting. Still managed to make it last 3 sips. Pours nearly black with a deep brown head.Big boozy, wood, and chocolate aroma. Taste is more bourbon than beer. Oaky, vanilla, booze burn, plenty of dark roasted coffee. Real good.

Pours thick deep black with good mocha head. Smell is big roasted coffee, bakers chocolate, booze, vanilla, earthy dark fruit and dried tobacco. Taste is dark bitter chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, roasted malts, light coconut and light booze. Full bodied smooth beer, hides ABV well. One of my favorite stouts to date. Firestone Walker nailed it with this Impy Stout!

Tasted at bottle share at the Syb Pig in Boca Raton, FL. Small snifter. Pours a jet black with thin off-white head. Slight lacing. The nose is chocolate, cocoa, vanilla, oak, bourbon, coffee and nuts. The tastes are chocolate, coffee, toasted malts, nuts, vanilla, and smoke. Very well balanced flavors with the hops. Smooth mouth, low carbonation, full body, sweet and coffee finish. I LOVE THIS beer.

Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass deep black, brownish head. Starts very strong, heavy malty, oily, fiery-alcoholic. Earthy-woody notes. Dry-bitter background. Not too roasty. Finish well balanced, still warming-alcoholic. Great Imperial Stout!

10oz on tap. Black as night, opaque, good lacing & adhesion, tan head. Aroma is strong, sweet, bready, and toasted. I cant appreciate this, man, its too much, dude. Like an imperial imperial stout. The bully of beer, strong even for the style. The body is so heavy & viscous - so creamy and alcoholic, too much of a good thing.

Bottle at Deans Birthday Tasting, August 2013. Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a deep mahogany with a glass hugging tan head. The flavour is rich malty and alcoholic. The flavour is strong bitter with lots of liqourice, alcohol, roasted malts and dark chocolate on the super smooth palate. This beer deserves its rating. My palate is still tingling.

Solid black with a thin beige, lasting lacy head. Smells of deep roasted coffee, raisin, dark chocolate. Full creamy body. Teases of deep bourbon spirit, roast and an alcohol finish. The alcohol is not that noticeable of you dont focus on it. Deep roast is amazing. One of the greats. I had it with some chocolate and it went together very well.

Bottle thanks to kermis. Pours dark brown. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, alcohol and more chocolate. Amazing sticky texture, lovely balance. Taste is sweet, light bitter. Deep chocolate flavour. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

66cl bottle shared, courtesy of Kermis @ Deans Birthday tasting. Big thanks
Thin tan head. Clear black pour. Awesome brew. Alcohol and bourbon notes. Well balanced
Black pour, tan head, decent lacing and retention. Aroma is oak, vanilla, chocolate, roast, darker fruit. Full bodied, alcohol hidden really well. Great.

8/18/13 bottle from a trade shared with my brother at a BBQ @ m&D. Pour a dark black with small tan head. Aroma of coffee chocolate, maple syrup after the empty glass. AMAZING!!!Taste of smooth dark chocolate and coffee AMAZING!!! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours an opaque, dark brown with a tan, foamy head. Aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, and a hint of oak. Tastes of roast malt, chocolate, coffee, and a medium bitter finish more from the roast than hops. Delicious, big beer.

Bottle at my place in the middle of the night with Taylor and Garrett. Pour a dark black with super small Yan head. Aroma of of coffee chocolate smooth malt, beautiful. Taste of smooth dark malt, chocolate malt , coffee malt, amazing beer. Finish is chocolate and delicious delicious. Mouth feel is full. Great beer, I would drink many more.

Draught @ Firestone Walker Barrelworks, Buellton, CA
Pours clear dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, vanilla, oak, caramel, licorice and alcohol. Taste is medium to heavy sweet and medium bitter with a long warm, roasted, vanilla, oak, chocolate and licorice finish. Body is full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

On tap at The Barrelworks. Pours dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of caramel, roasted notes, grains and vanilla. Flavor is sweet and roasted with some caramel, warming alcohol, bourbon and chocolate. Full body, average carbonation.

On tap at Firestone Walker Barrelworks. Dark brown body and a small beige head. Lots of chocolate on the nose, coffee too, alcohol chimes in, and some licorice and vanilla are also present. Full body, sweet and warming, with a pleasant level of carbonation. Lots of flavor, coffee and chocolate the most evident. Alcohol and vanilla and sweetness too. Really, really lasting finish. A bit warm this one, but wonderful anyway. 130809
On tap at Baileys Taproom (Portland). Ever-so-slightly clear black, slight lacing. Aroma of sweet brandy, booze, vanilla. Rich creamy vanilla chocolate flavour, roasty, with booze. Nice stuff!

Pours black with tan head. Roasted malt, chocolate, alcohol and wood aromas. Chocolate, roasted malts, coffee, toffee, wood, vanilla and some fruit and alcohol flavors. Full body and big roasted finish.
Bottle from the Bier Stein, Eugene. Pours a deep dark brown, little to no head. Aroma rich roasty, chocolate. Body rich, smooth, lingering notes of barrels, chocolate, bourbon, chocolate.

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: pitch black beer, small stable beige head.
NOSE: coffee, bourbon, chocolate, quite heavy, though good, rather neutral for an Imperial Stout though. Becomes better when warming up!
TASTE: vanilla, quite heavy, lots of chocolate. Very good!

Amazing. Tasted no hotness or booziness. Amazing for 13%. Bourbon is still there though. Sublimely intertwined with the stout. Lots of roastiness. Nice sweetness. Just an amazing beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

From the 2012 batch Reserve Series no. 003. It pours a rigorous dark brown to just about black with a full tan head that settles down after a few moments. The aroma is of dark malts, chocolate, wood, fig, and some earthy hops. The body is bold and smooth. The taste has a full upfront dark malt and licorice flavor with chocolate in the background and a moderate hop bitterness that almost erupts up my throat as an afterthought once I have swallowed. Dynamite!

Pours very dark almost no head. Sweet aroma and better taste. Tastes of chocolate and butterscotch, very complex. One of my absolute favorite beers. There are few beers that can compare to this beer if you can find it drink it!
UPDATED: JUL 26, 2013 Dark pour tan head. Hints of caramel chocolate and tobacco. Great beer, full bodied all there. If u can get it, try it!!
One of those well known beers that really live up to the hype. A pleasure to drink and expertly done.

On tap at Downtown Johnny Browns, San Diego.

Aroma - chocolate, molasses, theres sweet in here.

Appearance - black here at the bar but the subtle tan colored lacing suggests that in proper lighting it would be a very dark brown.

Taste - sweet and a heavy sweet at that. Maybe a very tiny touch of bitter on the finish but you have to think about it to notice. Caramel, molasses. 

Palate - full body, sticky, soft carbonation, bitter albeit very subtle on the finish.

Ive had this before out of a bomber but had to try on tap since I was in town for Comic-con and had the opportunity. This is a great sipper and one of my faves from one of my favorite brewers. If youre a fan of imperial stouts or English barley wines, you cant go wrong with this one!
2013 vintage on draft. Amazing color and aroma. Chocolate, coffee and bourbon. Taste is slightly boozy. Very smooth finish.
One of the better stouts I have had in a while. Has a complex aroma and a nice head. Had it in a snifter. Pours dark black. Very rich beer that stays with you a while after it goes down.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2013 On tap at City Beer Store SF on 061513. Black with with a nice tan head. Aroma has lots of creamy smooth chocolate, oak, bourbon, vanilla, very smooth aroma without any harsh roasted notes. With the creamy chocolate and vanilla notes it reminds me of a good chocolate icecream. Taste is bitter chocolate up front and then some bourbon and finally a light chocolate bitter finish with lots of creamy milk chocolate with a light alcohol note coming through as well. Full bodied and very smooth, no cloying sweetness.

Mild aroma and near perfect pour with strong lacing, balanced taste and growing warmth on the palate.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its not often in my jaded days that a beer gets a 4 or higher rating. Courtesy Secret Santa. Thanks man! Ive been waiting a long time to try this. Aroma was awesome. Vanilla, milk and notes of oak and roasted malt. Pour was a nice deep dark brown with a one finger tan head. Taste was delicious. My bottle said it was 13% and this beer hides it wonderfully. The vanilla and milk are there along with the wood. Sweet, but not cloying. Milk chocolate comes out as it warms. Mild carbonation. Well worth the wait!
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text:
22 fl oz / 650mL bottle into a tulip glass. Served cool. Bottled on 18 March 2013.

Aroma: Roasted malt and bittersweet chocolate. A lot of chocolate. It smells like a brick of chocolate. A little boozy.

Appearance: Completely opaque. Spare dark tan head. Good lacing.

Taste: Rich creamy chocolate. The alcohol is present, but you would never guess its 13% Creamy rich chocolate to the max.

Palate: Full body. Smooth texture. Moderate finish.

Overall: Where Samuel Smiths Organic Chocolate stout and Odells Lugene are like chocolate milk, this is like a luxurious, wonderful dark chocolate experience. Fantastic stuff.

Snifter at the brewery tasting room. 
Pours reddish brown - one of the lightest Russian Imperials I've ever seen. Smells of woody bourbon, smoke shop, vanilla, and coffee. Taste is a nice blend of rich sweet malts and amplified bitterness. Full bodied, mild carbonation, strangely astringent on the finish.
Very good, but not my favorite RIS.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Draft. Pours very dark opaque brown. Tastes very very sweet. Like molasses, brown sugar, raisins, caramel. Light body and medium carbonation. Smells like raisins, dates, figs.

Tap. Pours opaque black with a trace of fizzy beige head. Aroma is roast malts, bourbon, oak, earthy notes, dark fruit, vanilla, light spice. Flavor is roast malts forward with supporting booze, earthy notes, dark fruit esters, oak, and light sweetness; dry finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

I was like 5 bombers deep when my brother and I decided to crack one of the two bottles open. Didnt realize it was 13% and we each had just about a pint of this black/stout/wine/alcohol. Laughing at the fact me might get the spins and throw up. This beer left a distinctive reminder in the morning that it was BIG. Strong alcohol/stout/cherry aroma and the flavor followed the nose well. I was schmammered afterwards.

Bottle.  Gooey and black, the head is thin and tan.  The aroma is nearly medicinal, rich with whiskey and molasses.  This drinks with a super-rich character, boiling over with alcohol-heavy oak, bitter dark chocolate, a bit of tobacco.  Go forward carefully.  (#5061, 6/19/2013)

Pours black with tan head.  Aromas of bourbon, chocolate, and oak with the same flavors that follow.  This had a warm boozy backbone with some roasted goodness.  This was my first time trying it and look forward to it again.

2011 vintage.  Thin brown head that dissipates quickly.  Somewhat more mellow aroma than I expected but still very good.  Lots of dark malts, molasses, light bourbon, smoked grains and a bit of dark chocolate.  Color is opaque black.  Rich and malty aroma with lots of licorice, mild coffee, sweet malts, a hint of cough syrup, bourbon and some more smoked peaty flavors.  This seems like a cross between a big scotch ale and a impy.  Rather hot from the high alcohol content but it does not detract from the flavor.  Pretty easy drinking too.  Thick and chewey palate with lots of strong flavors that linger well after the swallow.  Finishes dark, smokey and hot.  A damn fine imperial stout.  Just wish it didnt cost so much.

Bomber. 2013. This was a share or I might have sat on it a bit longer. Big charred toasted boozy aroma. Chocolate and bourbon, some tobacco and leather. Warm beer. Flavor is chocolate, roasted malt, a bit of that acrid char. Big aggressive beer, but well balanced for all that. Really nice.

UPDATED: JUN 9, 2013 Here we go, rating #1000 (Mind you, more like beer # 5000, the remaining 4000 pre my RB time). 2011 bomber from an IP trade with richiesd, huge thanks! Pitch black color, brown head with not much retention, just a thin layer. Aromas: molasses, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, oak, but nothing too much, all perfectly balanced. Retronasal its a bit more alcoholic. Flavor is sweet, roasted malts, bourbon, chocolate. Alcohol feel is on the strong side, but manageable. Full bodied, almost syruppy. Long finish, with some wood, bit charcoal, and a light roasty bitterness. I was warned, but yep, this would be one of my favorites ever.

Killer imperial stout, sample pour of blackness and khaki head. Nose is dark chocolate and sweet caramel malt. Loads of smoothness on the mouth, little bit of oak. Almost nutty, and a smooth caramel finish. Im really enjoying this one for sure!

Philly Beer Week: Pours deep reddish black with a tan head.  Aroma is tobacco, roast, coffee and dark chocolate.  Taste is sweet with some roasty bitters.  Incredibly smooth and easy to drink, alcohol is exceptionally well hidden.  Excellent.
On tap at lunar brewing. Aroma is rich dark chocolate and bourbon. Flavor is sweet dark chocolate, caramel, and a really nice bourbon flavor. Epic beer!!
I didnt find this to be hot or boozy at all.  Drinks well fresh, and I can only imagine it will improve over time.

Poured from a 2013 bottle into a snifter. Almost black with tan head. 
Smells of coconut molasses alcohol boozy.
Taste is an exceptional imperial stout with a raisin dark chocolate sweetness while not too hot.  Happy to lay my other two down to savor down the road.
Overall LOVE the flavor of this 2013. A strong favorite for me next to Dark Lord.

Black pour with a tan head. Aroma is bourbon, oak, roasted malt. Taste is wonderful- creamy, oak, bourbon, roasted malt. They are blended so well you would think God brewed this. So glad to see this on the shelves at my local, though they all sold out in 24 hours. Thick, oily, chewy. Leaves a sweet roasted flavor with a bitter aftertaste(woods and hops imho). The right beer to drink on the porch as I watch it rain. The beer clung to the side of the glass.

Sample at CBC 2013.

Black with a brown head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, hops, vanilla, licorice and bourbon.
Strong cocoa flavor spiked by the barrel aging. #BeerSnob

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2013 No bottling date visible, but it was purchased at release, so its less than 3 months old.
Appearance: Pitch black body, thin tan head with average retention. The head settles into a foamy coating.
Aroma: The aroma is complex with sweet milk chocolate being on the forefront along side vanilla, coconut and bourbon.
Taste: Dark chocolate, roasted malts and light bourbon are on the intro that lead into the mid-taste. Coconut and bourbon come in during the end of the mid-taste with a touch of roasted malts, sweet chocolate and vanilla. Bourbon lingers on the finish with light oak.
Palate: Thick and velvety with light carbonation.
Overall: This is an excellently priced bourbon barrel aged imperial stout and this vertical has been fun seeing the differences between batches. I believe that the differences throughout are attributed to the batch variations rather than the changes of aging. This is a must buy if seen.


Bottled March 14, 2012 (1.3 years old).
Appearance: Pitch black body, thin tan head with average retention. The head settles into a frothy ring and a sparse coating.
Aroma: The aroma is strong of chocolate and coconut milk, upon swirling vanilla becomes prominent. Bourbon is very light on this, its hidden behind the more prominent aromas.
Taste: Sweet chocolate and vanilla greet the tongue immediately, with coconut milk quickly coming in with a bourbon backing. The finish has bourbon prominent that lingers with syrupy chocolate for a bit, the bourbon lingers long. Theres a touch of roasted malts towards the end of the mid-taste into the finish.
Palate: Creamy with light carbonation.
Overall: This is excellent. I enjoy the richness of this that I didnt find in the 2011. Coconut is very prominent and the bourbon is toned down. Very sippable.
Ratings: Ar: 8, Ap: 4, Ta: 8, Pa: 5, Ov: 16

Bottled April 20, 2011 (2.2 years old).
Appearance: Pitch black body with a thin tan head, average retention and settles into a bubbly ring and a sparse coating.
Aroma: Chocolate is prominent, though its slightly bittersweet instead of overly sweet. Bourbon is the next most prominent aroma, though its not overwhelming, its almost on par in strength with the chocolate though. Vanilla and oak act as supporting roles with hints of dark fruits and roasted malts. This smells nice.
Taste: Syrupy bittersweet chocolate is the strongest flavor here and its matched nicely by a bourbon presence. Roasted malts are introduced on the mid-taste and are really mild, a bit restrained until the finish which is sweet syrupy chocolate and roasted malts with a long finish of bourbon and oak. This is excellent.
Palate: Medium to thick bodied with sharp carbonation. Im surprised how lively this is for a beer of this style that is this old.
Overall: Parabola is one of my favorite bourbon barrel aged imperial stouts. This is balanced nicely despite the prominent bourbon flavors. This leans a touch sweet and is a great sipping beer. I would never pass this up, thats for sure.
Ratings: Ar: 7, Ap: 4, Ta: 8, Pa: 5, Ov: 15

Nice smell and taste.  Vanilla really comes out in this one.  Slight warmness and dry taste on the tongue.  This one reminded me of Hoppin Frog Doris a lot.  Both are really good if you like BB aged brews.
Really, RB, the hype on this is undeserved. Poured a deep black with minimal head. A huge, boozy mess. Way too hot. Next year I will cellar a bottle, but I thought this was ready to drink now.

On tap, poured in to a snifter. Black, viscous, tan head. Aroma is chocolate, oak, bourbon, licorice, dark roasted malt and coffee, fairly boozy. Taste is chocolatey, lots of oak, bourbon, black licorice, bitter, fairly hoppy. Full bodied, mouth coating, bitter finish. Overall, this is the best BA stout Ive ever had and it sets the standard for the genre.

22oz bottle in a snifter.  Pours black with a lacy, tan head.  Aroma of bourbon and oak, some roasted malts and chocolate, a little coffee, and light bitterness.  Flavor the same but a little light on the finish.  Smooth texture.  A pretty good imperial stout, but not the best of its style.

Goodness me. 
Aroma is bitter cocoa, bourbon, tobacco and campfire. Taste is intense bourbon, aggressive oak, and superbly balanced chocolate and malt character. Im not worthy to analyze this beer.
Apperence dark brown with a tan head. Aroma of cherries and coffee taste of coffee and ferries and bitter chocolate.  Long lasting on the palate
Boozy as hell. Choc full of pungent dates and raisins. Charcoal and chocolate. Boy is this a beast.
Opaque dark brown color with a tan head. Nice brown sugar, dark fruit and bourbon aroma. Delicious rich bourbon, vanilla, brown sugar, and dark fruit flavor.

Pours black with ruby highlights and no head. Very sweet bourbon aromas with a bit of oak. Sweet and syrupy up front but immediately mellows into rich bitter chocolate and whisky. Ends with an espresso chocolate finish. Low carbonation. A wonderfully complex beer.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2014 
65 cl bottle (14% bc). 2014 vintage. Bottle No 694388. BBE 10.04.2014.
Lots of vanilla and bourbon on the nose, chocolate, dark malts, some wooden notes, The hoppiness and chocolate is still very nice here. Brilliance.
65 cl bottle. 2011 vintage. Bottle No 58573. BBE 30.04.2014.
Pours pitch black color with a medium sized beige head. Aroma has dark roasted malts, faint hop notes, sweetish caramel, some dry ashy cocoa, dark chocolate and bourbon. Some vanilla can be found also.
Bursting with different flavors; dark roasted malts, some soy, coffee notes, salty licorice, vanilla, faint tobacco, syrup, some molasses and dark chocolate. A bit sticky and sweet palate, mild bitter and lingering chocolaty finish. Some reminiscents to Dechutes Abyss. Very heavy and complex brew with lots of nice nuances. A s l o w drinking beer. Somehow managed to hit my sweet spot. Top notch. Probably on my top 10.
5318

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 65 cl bottle vintage 2011 @ home, BBE 30.04.2014(German label)
Bottle number 58573, front label says 12,5% and back label 13%.
Aroma is sweet and feels sticky. It has cocoa, semi‐dark chocolate, some licorice and vanilla. Flavour is sweet with cocoa, whiskey notes, salty licorice and some vanilla. Finishes with stinging whiskey and peat. Thick and sticky palate. Nice, the sweetness that grows towards the end of the glass almost ruins the show though. Bourbon aged Deschutess Abyss would perhaps taste like this if it existed.

65 cl bottle vintage @ VastActiv
Rather sweet with all that licorice and sugar, not that good as the older ones. Not bad still.

2011 bomber pours a dark brown/black with a thin reddish tan head. Aroma of chocolate, molasses, dark fruits, oak, and bourbon. Something in the aroma also reminds me of maple syrup and waffles. Taste of sweet chocolate, molasses, vanilla and oak, with undertones of bourbon and finishing with tobacco and leather. All together well balanced and smooth.

Location: Draft at Pony HK, 5/15/13, #3001: Ill start off the quest for 4k with a big one.  


Aroma: It has a nose of dark malts and bourbon, with some chocolate, coffee, roast, and wood

Appearance: This one has a black colored pour with a brown head that leaves heavy lace

Flavor: The taste is much the same as the nose, with heavy malty and bourbon flavors

Palate: The body is full, it has a thich feel, and quite a bit of boozy heat on the mouth

Overall Impression: 
First off, we were very excited when the bell rang and this got added to the draft list!  This beer is an absolute beast.  Its big and boozy, and it is also well made.  This is clearly a sipper, and clearly something I dont need a ton of in one sitting, but Firestone does a very nice job with barrel ageing beers.

UPDATED: APR 25, 2016 650 ml bottle from Wilburs, 2013 version, 13%.  Black pour with small brown head and patchy lacing.  The aroma is rich with roasted malts, dark chocolate, burnt wood and light bourbon.  Similar flavor with some vanilla, light coffee and faint dark fruits.  It hides the alcohol rather well.  Full body with a soft and smooth velvety feel.  An excellent sipper and a truly incredible beer.  849519 4.5  Update: Fresh 650 ml bottle from Mulberry Max, 2016 vintage, 13.1% ABV.  Thick, opaque black appearance with a small light brown head.  Aroma of big roasted malt, big charred oak, rich chocolate, light coffee, light vanilla and hints of bourbon.  Similar flavor, rich and thick with a full body.  Three years ago, this was one my absolute favorite beers.  It is still very good, but probably in the low 4s for me nowadays.

2011 22oz bomber, drank in late May 2013.  Thick brown black body, opaque.  Respectable rusty beige head sticks around for awhile.  Big sweet oak and chocolate aroma.  A truly great Imperial Stout, massive and sugary, but refined and quite enjoyable.  Lots of depth..deep bourbon caramel oak vanilla notes.  World Class, this is really well done.

Oily black. Small tan bubbling. Smells like oak an alcohol. Tastes like cocoa, toffee, vanilla, oak, toasty dark malts and alcohol. Pretty damn good but the alchyness is a little offputting. The flavor is really good though.
On tap at Churchkey during Savour week. Very well balanced, low carbonation beer. Subtle flavours balance the bourbon at warmer temps

Bottle @CBC13. Pitch black with small tan head. Aroma intense; roastiness, coffee, bourbon, tobacco, dark chocolate and tar. Taste is very rich and full, same notes as aroma plus some plums and berries, finish is tarry and roasted.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 2013 bottle. Pitch black with a great tan brown cap. Raisin, chocolate, licorice, biscuit, coffee, wood, bourbon aroma. Taste is the same but with cherry, and HARD dry wood palate. 2014. Bottle share. Thanks Leo! So much cocoa nib aroma, molasses, plum, bourbon. Taste is sweet and sharp bitterness. Smooth. This can only get better. 2011. Bottle share. Thanks me! Same aroma notes, but brilliantly smooth. Can still get the boozy tingle at the finish. 2012 bottle. Once more, a brilliant drink.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2013 2013 bottle Poured into a snifter. Extremely dark pour with a mocha brown head that laces a bit, but sticks around the edge. Aroma is chocolate, coffee, cereal. Taste is pretty big on chocolate and coffee. A little booze and lots of vanilla. Some woodiness in the finish. less bourbon than expected. Medium thick mouth feel.
Bomber->snifter.  Deep brown with lite brown head.  Chocolate, vanilla, roasted malt, espresso.  Rich, complex, very good.  Only complaint is a tad too boozy.

Not a heavy barrel presence, which is a good thing. Extremely silky and smooth mouthfeel. Nice sweet vanilla flavors balanced out by roastiness. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had on tap. Serious stout. Amazing balance and complexity.  Nutty, chocolate, sweet, oak, and just all around amazing.  You can taste the alcohol a bit much, but that's my only dig.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Amazing brew. Outstanding aroma of milk chocolate and hazelnut. Flavor starts out mild with a sweet vanilla taste until the roasted barley (or malt) and hops kick in all at once. Leaves a mild but lasting finish. Alcohol is barely noticeable but warmth is.

Shared bottle at local tasting. Pours entire black with a nice tanned head. Aroma of roasted malts, tar,liquorice and tobacco. Taste is superb liquorice mixed with rich burnt malts. Smooth and thick mouthfeel. Lovely beer.
Draught at CBC. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Black colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate.

650 ml bottle, kindly shared by gunnar. ABV is 12.5%. Pitch black colour, moderate to low tan head. Intense roasty aroma, notes of dark bitter chocolate, tar, tobacco, leather and coffee. Same elements in the flavour, intensely tarry and rich, salty finish.

Fra flaske på CBC mai-13: denne kom tidlig i programmet, og ble en benchmark for resten av dagen. Et klasseøl i aller øverste liga, som å få en håndlaget belgisk konfekt i munnen. Måtte tilbake for påfyll, dette er virkelig noe av det lekreste jeg har smakt innen imp.stout eller øl overhode.

Sample at CBC 2013, Friday.

Black with a small head. A very nice beer this one. Bourbon, oak, chocolate, some alcohol and dried fruit. Heavy body and with a long aftertaste. Balanced and so nice!

[5/3/13] Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Black-colored, not opaque, with a light brown foam. Aroma of dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, soy sauce and alcohol. Wonderful sweet flavor with lots of chocolate, some bourbon and vanilla. Very full thick body. One of my top two beers in the festival.

Tap at Live Oak. Pours a dark murky brown color. Very muddy in appearance. Tan colored head. Aroma is sweet chocolate, vanilla, oak and ice cream. Smooth thick mouthfeel. Flavor is all wood, oak, vanilla, bourbon and dark chocolate sweetness. Syrupy. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle snagged in Seattle and drunk in a hotel lobby.  Oatmeal taste and a bit lighter than expected, but a fantastic imperial stout.

UPDATED: MAY 9, 2013 Almost no head. Beautiful jet black color. Excellent  nose. Tabacco, dark cacao, anise. Mild bourbon, charred oak. Great balance. Excellent!!  One of my favs so far this year... Will buy another and cellar it for next year!

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2013 Bottle. Pours beautiful deep dark, full dense mocha head. Aroma of dark fruit, bourbon, vanilla, tobacco, firestone barrel sexiness. Taste: charred oak, chocolate, some oxidation, alcohol warmth. Oxidation becomes more prominent with further sips.  Viscous, smooth, velvet texture. Full body, surprisingly well carbonated. Bitter finish. Overall- Parabola is one of my all-time favorites, and its great at any age.  Previous experience dictates, though, that you should drink this one sooner rather than later, since it drinks beautifully right out of the gate and it only seems to deteriorate with age. (2010: 9/5/7/5/16)
 
2013: As in 2010 rating above, but minus oxidation, more barrel and roast.  Hard to be objective about this one because I love it so much. (9/5/9/5/18)
Chocolate milkshake, caramel, bourbon, tobacco, and malt. Great aroma and lacing. Palate is killer. Great beer.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2013 Pitch black, thin brown head. Charred wood alternating with rich chocolate, caramel, plums, figs, and cherries. Velvety smooth, full-bodied, and the right amount of carbonation. Pleasant, mildly bitter, mildly boozy finish.
Bottled at CBC. Boozy aroma with huge cocoa and fruit notes. There are strong notes of wood here, some molasses. Bourbon is there but extremly toned. Extremely balanced and an awesome beer

I havent had Parabola before, and Ive heard good things about the barrels. However, this year they used Four Roses barrels. Its a good imperial stout, but its nothing to write home about. Oh, and several places wont even sell it yet. If you like big boozy stouts, grab a bottle of this. VERY limited, too.

One of the best imperials out there! Black as night with a lasting head. Strong aroma with astringent hops. A truly unique beer with many great qualities.  Share with a friend as the ABV is high and will sneak up on you.

@ rampkrot 
shared with bart vanpucke
pours very dark brown, very fast fading white foam. smell is very nice, balanced, sweet, soft carbo. very balanced, nice roasted malts, chcolate, coffee, bitter, not too much bourbon, so realy nice !
Pitch black, no head. Dark chocolate, figs, forest hops, but mostly dark chocolate. Beautiful body. Powerful flavours, bit boozy but never too much. Very tasty. (ZeeBra)

Poured a very dark brown with a small beige head. Aroma of roasted caramel malt, dark berry fruit and dark chocolate with some lit cigar. Full. creamy body, flavour of the aroma, some wooden notes in the background. Dry, bitter end.

Strong aromas of cocoa nibs, oak and wood. Pure black with beautiful lacing. Incredibly smooth with delicious flavors of chocolate, toffee, burnt sugar and dates upfront. Finish brings hinted booze, coffee beans, strong oak, wood and molasses to the palate. Overall, this is a strong beer yet it is remarkably smooth and drinkable. Complexity is off the charts and balance is perfect. An incredible Imperial Stout. Id give this an A+ rating.

Release #004, Pours thick and nearly black with a tiny lip of tan foam that fades nicely. Aromas are toffee, bourbon, caramel, wood, chocolate and licorice. Flavors are amazing in complexity with bourbon and barrel being predominant during the entire experience and notes of caramel, toffee, chocolate, coffee, clove, all spice, anise, leather and others coming through (to be honest this beer reminds me of my wine drinking days and how a good cab sauv would give off tons of different flavors). Mouthfeel is silky and rich and thick but not cloying, coats the tongue nicely without overwhelming the palate. Overall, this is still my favorite beer that I have had on multiple occasions, I wish I could drink more of this it is that good!

Bottle sampled at CBC.  Pours almost black with a ring beige head.  Aroma of caramel, toffee, chocolate, vanilla, wood, light coffee and molasses.  Flavor is heavy sweet and moderate bitter.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.  Simply amazing!

Nose is coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, molasses. Mouth is vanilla, cacao beans, espresso, walnuts, muscovado sugar, leather and hints of tobacco. Absolutely stunning!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Wow. This was very smooth to enjoy. Nice notes of caramel and roasted coffee. Will have another please!
Amazing strong Russian imperial stout, Surly Goat in WeHo. Intense but overlla delicious.

Near black pour with a thin khaki head that fades to a ring. Aroma is strong sweet chocolate initially. There is also molasses, vanilla, bourbon, wood, and some smoke in there. Taste has a ton of dark chocolate up front with sweet caramel and vanilla coming next. Finishes with wood, char, and a subtle booze. A different flavor combination with each drink. Char aftertaste. Slick oily palate. Great beer.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 On draft a Pizzeria Paradiso in Old Town, Alexandria, VA.  Vintage 2011.  Pours black with a tan head.  Aroma of toasted malt and smoke oak.  Flavors of plum, raisin and dark cherries with bourbon notes.  Nice.  

From a 22 oz bottle - vintage 2013.   Some espresso notes with the dark fruits.  Superb!

22 ounce bottle shared, 2012 vintage.  Aroma is was smokey, warm, oak, chocolate-vanilla spiked with bourbon and coffee. A frontier campfire comes to mind.  Appearance is dark black-brown, completely opaque, thick flow, dark brown head. Taste is much like the aroma: big on oak bourbon barrels, malts & oats, boozy, smoke and leather, sweet and woodsy. Palate is creamy, mild carbonation, long-lasting flavor presence. Overall satisfying on all aspects, plus it avoids stepping into candyland sweetness territory.  I really liked the dried tobacco leaf and leather components that give this one a distinct interpretation on the imperial stout style.

Had in a tasting with black note stout.  I prefer that to this.  This seems a little thinner than black note.  Has more of a bourbon bite, maybe a little more carbonated than I would like.  Very tasty, not not one of the best barrel aged beers out there.

Bottle, 2012, from trade. Pours a thick black brown with thin lacy tan head that slides brown down the glass but doesnt stick. Aroma of coffee up front, bourbon vanilla oak at the middle, slight boozy note at the end. Taste follows, but booze is hidden by the sweetness.  I could see some more age doing nice things for this, can get really sweet by the end, but very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 24, 2015 Taken from notes. 750 ml, shared at Sloshfest - thanks André. Pours dark brown, aroma of nuts, liquorice and bourbon. Very round and creamy mouthfeel, taste is rich yet alcohol is too present.
------ sloshfest10  11 13 14. Preferred the 2011. Really balanced

Bottle courtesy of rosebudbutternuts.  Black in the glass.  Smoky dried fruit aroma with a hint of tobacco.  Sweet creamy mocha flavors, dark cocoa and espresso flavors with a touch of cola.  Overall, a pleasure to drink...
A bit disappointed. Sure, Its very creamy and has a lot of roasted notes, but it comes across as quite boozy. Too much so for a higher score..
2011 bottle. Black, dark brown head. Nose is Forrest cake, vanilla, some barrel. Taste is Forrest cake, vanilla, cinnamon, and a touch of bourbon. Medium mouthfeel. Incredible.

Still to date my favorite BA Stout. Smells of slight chocolate, caramel, molasses, slight vanilla and bourbon. Body is full and rich, taste of Bourbon up front followed by a very very sweet taste. There is still a ton of BA stouts I have yet to try. But not only does this beer taste incredible. Its extremely affordable compared to other BA Stouts, Im looking at you Rasputin!

2011 Parabola poured into a tulip glass. Pours a nice dark motor oil color with a foamy white head that doesnt last too long. Aroma is awesome with a nice bourbon scent but also some undertones of charred oak, chocolate and smoke. Flavor is oily smooth and coats your tongue. Flavor is very astringent chocolate, bourbon and oak with . Finish is kind of hot but a nice oily smooth sweet finish. Mouthfeel is oily sweet and and carbonation is below-average. This is an awesome beer and one of myu top 5s.

Pours a very dark brown, with a brown-tan, quickly attenuating head. Aromas of sorghum, coconut, chocolate, and tobacco. The mouthfeel is creamy and viscous, with some scrubbing on the back of the tongue at the finish. Milk chocolate, coconut, and unflavored leaf tobacco are prevalent and alternating flavors. There is even that mild pang in the back of the jaw that occasionally occurs with dry leaf, unflavored chewing tobacco. Notes of sorghum and bourbon as well. This is my favorite FW brew. Its a phenomenal concoction.
Bottle from international trade; dark brown with tan head, feint bourbon aroma, raisins bourbon, really train beer.
UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 Bottle share at Voodoo. Great malty taste. Im a little cold to be rating things but this is good shit. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: JAN 18, 2014 On tap at Riverside. Pours black with light cream head.  Light carb med bid.. Harsh coffee bitter taste.

22oz bottle split. 2012 vintage.

A: Black as the heart of the devil with a sparse mocha foam for a head. Good legs, and this has a solid inky outlook. 

N: Lots of licorice, chocolate, tobacco, and dark chocolate candies. Fudge and theres noticeable oak. Vanilla and caramel act as a backdrop. Theres a touch of raisin and prune as well as coffee. 

T: Roasted coffee, fudge, dark chocolate, coffee, lots of smoke and tobacco over the top of the sweet base. However, it adds bitterness rather than ashtray. I enjoy how it has two distinguishable tiers. Theres a light licorice flavor, and the oak also adds a lot of chippiness to the proceedings. Leans towards astringency by the end.

M: Oily and slick. Very full texture. Alcohol is expertly hidden.

O: This vintage is doing very well, though theres definitely a lot of oak so be prepared for the grain. However, for being such a behemoth, it never loses its presence by hiding behind a cloying underattentuation. Props to this one. Ill have another.

22oz bottle from 2011. Pours thick reddish muddy color with thin head. Aroma is wood, booze, sweet caramel, sherry, vanilla, and a touch of brown sugar. Flavor follows the nose exactly. Has the booze and vanilla upfront, the caramel in the middle and finishes with a touch of sherry.

Bottle, Batch 001.  Pours black with frothy, filmy brown, chocolate head.  Nose is oak, chocolate, vanilla, mellowed alcohol and dark fruit.  Chocolate, vanilla, oak, silky smooth, mild alcohol, reasonably bitter and lingering.  Raost and alcohol.  Mildly fruit.  Amazing.

On tap (FSW tap takeover) @ Livermore Saloon during SF Beer Week.  Smells like chocolate, cherry/plum, baking pastries = yes, very good.  Taste is complex, same as smells with a sweetness, bourbon, vanilla, roasted nuts.  Full taste but very smooth and creamy, does stick to the tounge like a high % IPA, but changed for the better as it warmed up.  Not an imperial stout guy but loved this one.

Pitch black, thin brown head. Charred wood alternating with rich chocolate, caramel, plums, figs, and cherries. Velvety smooth, full-bodied, and the right amount of carbonation. Pleasant, mildly bitter, mildly boozy finish.

Bottle: Poured a pitch-black color stout with a nice large dark brown foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of black chocolate with some light vanilla notes and some light dry roasted malt. Taste is dominated by loads of black chocolate notes with some light dry roasted malt and some vanilla and light bourbon notes. Taste is definitely quite complex and not as dry as expected with quite a bit of residual sugar coming through.  Body is full with a really nice creamy texture and some good carbonation with no apparent alcohol. I cant find many fault in this beer except that that bourbon could bit a bit more pronounced.

Bottle. Pours black with a ring of cream head. Aroma is roasted malts and bourbon. Flavor is sweet malts, chocolate and a boozy bourbon finish. Very smooth, great aftertaste and just awesome. Nothing at all wrong with this.

Bomber poured into a tulip. Pours nearly black with a nice tan ring in the glass. Huge aroma of bourbon, oak, vanilla, roasty malt, and dark chocolate. Taste is sweet and quite bitter. Mouthfeel is very smooth, coats the tongue. Great!

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2016 re-rate 8/16 - actually showed up locally on tap at the GREAT Holy Grail............no change in rating...........but I think this is best with some age on it.  much bourbon in aroma and taste but the sweetness of this is what got to me on draft.  2nd snifter was better.  still love this.......................re-rate 01/15.   2 year old bomber.  no change on raing  4.5.   had warm and cool - better cool.  at times this is perfection......................bomber to glass; recd in trade from storminnormin?  2011 bottle.  WOWOW!  lots of stuff in aroma; I cant name all of them - alcohol, much chocolate roasts, CHOCOLATE.  5 for app (darrrrk) and palate (smooth and thick).  Taste was near perfection - chocolate, choc. milk bourbon, slight vanilla,  DAMMMMOT this is great - must find more!!  tied for my highest rated beer ever!!!

From bottle, courtesy of dpjuart. Awesome nose. Oak, vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, coffee, toffee, caramel. Just a real nice blend of aromas. Dark black opaque with thin creamy tan head. Heavy oily body with medium-high carbonation, chewy with alcohol warming. Starts sweet with alcohol, oak, vanilla, bourbon. Boozy and a tad too sweet, but rich and delicious, silky and smooth. Terrific impy stout, with a hint of soy sauce and broth at the very end.

Pours jet black, motor oil thickness with no head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, roast and molasses. Taste is bourbon, oak vanilla and roast. Nice and chewy, flavor increases as it warms, there is a lot going on here. I really like this one. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle @ Christers. Courtesy of Adnielsen, thanks alot Aaron ! Pours pitch black with a small light brown head. Had to be noted that looks is the only minor "downside" to this beer. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, wood, vanilla, bourbon, dark chocolate, coconut. Flavor is malts, bourbon, oak, wood, coffee, dark chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits, plums, figs. Lots going and still very well balanced. Full body, soft carbonation, light warming alcohol in the finish. Fan-fuckin-tastic over the top beer. 040213

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting courtesy of adnielsen. Thanks a lot! Black with a lasting brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, bourbon, wood and notes of vanilla. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Dry and roasted rather bitter finish. Oily and smooth. 040213

Bottle from adnielsen. Almost black with small light brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon, vanilla and wood. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, wood, vanilla, bourbon, liquorice, dark fruits, oak, medium sweet and a little bitter.
Bottle. Nice head with good duration. Color is black. Aroma and taste are rich roast malt, bourbon, vanilla, wood, chocolate, coffee, tobacco and notes of hops. Wonderful finish. Yummy.
Tap. The smell is coffee, roasted malts, dark chocolate, wood , and really nice. The look is dark, black in color, with a beige head. The taste is roasty, coffee, malt, chocolate, and great.
Bourbon and sweet caramel vanilla aroma. Pours black with a brown head. Oh my God is it good. Like aged whiskey with caramel cream and a body you can chew on. It is absolutely amazing.
2011 bottle poured a near black. Smells of roasted malt, molasses, vanilla, oak, and licorice. Taste coffee, roasted malts, chocolate, smoked wood, and finishes slightly boozy.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2013 Aroma is a really nice balanced note of chocolate, roast and barrel qualities. Some complimentary fruit character. Nice oak, vanilla and oak character. Some faint booziness in the aroma. 
Pours a dark brown, not quite black with a thin light mocha head that quickly recedes to the edges. No lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is so nice. Light chocolate and faint roast with balanced fruitiness. Some sweet vanilla and milk chocolate. Fruit is prune and cherry. A bit of alcohol spice in the finish with oak and roast. Medium low bitterness and a faint hop flavor. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium alcohol warmth. some silky smoothness to this. 
Overall this is an amazingly nice beer. So well balanced and with a great mouthfeel. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2015 2011 vintage in a trade. Poured on 1/22/13. Pours deep black with no light let in. Aggressive-ish pour left with a tiny brown head. Aroma is very strong vanilla, molasses, chocolate, licorice, and of course plenty of bourbon. Really beautiful. Thick an viscous mouthfeel opens up to Very mellow bourbon tones, lots of vanilla, and a burst of chocolate on the finish. Mild carbonation that is right on for this. Incredibly mellow, and I am curioud is that is the age or the uncanny craft of FW. Prickle of alcohol burn on the tongue, and a nice bit of warmth on the way down. Probably a new favorite BA Stout for me. Just right.
Shared bomber to snifter.  Minimal head.  Deep black but thinner than thick.  Perfect aroma and taste for a BA stout.  Long awaited and did not disappoint.

Pours black with tan head.  Smell of coffee and alcohol.  Taste of coffee chocolate and strong alcohol taste. Good.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Euclid Hall. Pour is pitch black with a small brown head and decent lacing. Deep roast, light cocoa, smoke, peat, leather, bourbon, wood, caramel, licorice, and dark fruits in the aroma. Taste is super velvety, vanilla, coconut, dark chocolate, coffee, oak, plums, bourbon, roast, and cherries with a light alcoholic burn on the finish. Syrupy mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Deep, flavorful, and complex with beautifully hidden alcohol. Well done.

22oz bottle, 2012 vintage, shared. Dark but not completely opaque color. More of a clear dark brown color. Thin bubbly light brown head, good lace. Whiskey, roasty light bitter chocolate nose, light spice. Bigger body, light carbonation. Dry finish. Flavors of dark fruit: cherry, fig, bitter dark chocolate. Roasty malts. Good bitter sweet taste. Noticeable alcohol, but it works well the the roasty chocolate vanilla stout flavors. Bitter, sweet taste. Very enjoyable sipper. Great barrelly dark fruit roasty coffee dark chocolate vanilla aftertaste.

(22oz bomber bottle) Thanks Barley Mowat. Pours a creamy yellow brown head atop an opaque body. Very vanilla and wooden nose. Chalky front with a smooth vanilla oil and gritty cocoa. So subtly balanced, good alcohol but not hot or sweet. Wonderful.

Poured from a 22 ounce bottle into a brandy snifter. Pours a near black with a khaki colored ring of foam around the edge of the glass. The aroma is a little more boozy and sock-like than I like of my barrel aged beers. Taste is very roasty and has lots of cacao nib and whiskey burn. Hefty beer. The 12.5% abv really isnt covered well.

Bomber many thx to adnielsen cons 2012-12-31 Göteborg
Perfect finale to finish the Hogmanny dinner! Starter: Cantarell soup, Main:  Sole Walewska och pommes duchesse, Desert: Milk chocolate Pannacotte mmmmm
AR: vanilla bourbone, daim, chocolate pudding
AP: thick dark brown fluid, wee heavy dark brown stouthy quickly disapperaring head, no lacings
F: fizzy, dark truffel chocolate, scottish butter fudge, daim, bourbon vanilla, warming smooth feeling, sugary/grainy feeling, finish is loaded with bourbon vanilla and that thick devine chocolate

Bottle. Pours a dark brown/almost black with minimal head. Aroma is caramel, mocha, dark chocolate, sweetness, : mocha, caramel, dark chocolate, bit alcoholic, sweet sugary, vanilla. Taste is sweet bourbon (vanilla, caramel, slight oak), sweet dark malts, almost hints of smoke, dark chocolate.  Medium/soft carbonation, and medium to full mouthfeel. SOme booze does come out.  Very nice.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2013 650ml bottle from a trade, thanks stawn!

2011 vintage - Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Lovely aroma of sweet syrup, roasted malts, oak, vanilla, dark chocolate, bourbon and wood. Taste is sweetish (but not over the top) with nice wooden oaky notes, vanilla, licorice, dark chocolate and hints of syrup. Smooth, slightly roasty finish with sweetish syrupy notes and a lot of vanilla, oak, smoky wood, dark chocolate and warming alcohol. Almost perfectly balanced, simply awesome barrel aged IS. Nom nom. 9-4-9-4-18 = 4.4
Re-rated on 29.11.2013. 2013 vintage from Bier-deluxe. Stingy vanilla bourbon notes are much more aggressive on a fresh bottle, and also some hoppiness is notable. Still extremely well balanced. Damn, this is tasty.

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2014 650 ml bottle, thanks tiong. Pours a pitch black colour with a small beigeish head. Aroma of rich dry wood, vanilla and strong dark chocolate. Flavor is very rich with roasted malts, vanilla, bourbon, raisins, tar and dry apples. Full bodied, rich mouthfeel and oily, smoky, sweet, woody finish. Lovely.
650 ml bottle. 2011 vintage.
Pours a pitch black colour with a beige head. Aroma of roasted malts, vanilla, wood and strong wet earthiness. Very rich flavour of roasted malts, vanilla, ice cream, wooden notes, caramel, tart-ish cherries and chocolate biscuit. Full bodied, long warming finish. Great stuff. Pretty much the same as last time. 8-4-9-5-17 4.3
650 ml bottle. Vertical tasting with 2012 and 2014 vintages.
More of the differences in this rating. 2012 is a bit too tart now. The wooden notes have taken over, and theres very little sweetness left. This rating is more abou the 2014 vintage. The 2014 version is very, very sweet with rich English toffee notes, rich roastiness, coffee and mudcake. Vanilla notes are very subtle but noticeable. Reminds me of a vanilla shake a bit. Bourbon smoothens the flavour nicely. A fresh version rocks the world. 9-4-9-5-17 4.4

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Bottle shared by Phredrik. Pours pitch black. Aroma of roasted coffee, soy sauce, liquorice, rich chocolate, raw cocoa beans, kinda meaty and savory with a bit of a perfumish touch of vanilla. Taste of soy sauce,rich chocolate, bitter coffee, dark cherry, cocoa beans, some warm alcohol, molasses and vanilla. Very very nice!

Re rate 2014. This goes 0,1 up ! Really gewd and just amazingly complex!

Bottle.  Pours black with a small brown head.  Aroma is bourbon, coffee, strong oak, a little alcohol.  Taste is very sweet, dominated by bourbon, some vanilla, chocolate, with a roasted background.  Finish is roasty and a little alcoholic.  Very full bodied, syrupy, soft carbonation.  Big big beer.

Pours black with little head. Chocolate, smoke and biscuity malt on the nose and tongue. Well balanced and great palate. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

22 ounce bottle.  2011.  Pours black with a nice tan head.  Aroma of malt, bourbon, vanilla, and chocolate.  Taste is roasted malt, dark chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, and wood.  Interesting, complex, and excellent.
My rating got lost, but I mind this beer. My brother, daikon, cold hard facts and it's my balls.

Dark beer with very little carbonation that left a slick of a head.  Lots of alcohol and bourbon in the nose.  Flavors of rich bitter chocolate, vanilla, oak, brown sugar and some apple.  Nice warming alcohol bloom as it warms with a little burn in the finish.  Very nice BA beer.

Bottle of 12 vintage. Pours black with brown head that seems to magically appear. Aroma of vanilla, bourbon, chocolate, dried figs and coffee. Flavors of chocolate, coffee and charred oak. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Great beer. Drink now.

Tap: black pour with medium-sized tan head. Aroma is bourbon barrel with caramel and alcohol. Flavor has lots of sweet toffee with some dark roasted grain, coffee, oaky vanilla and ends with a big burst of alcohol. Very sweet, sticky but creamy palate that has a big alcohol warmth at the end.  This beer smell great and is a nice sipping beer.

66cl Bottle at Sloshfest. Black colour, brown head. Aroma of hard roasted malts, bitter chocolate, tobacco, bourbon, light oak and vanilla, little ashy. Flavour is sweet, hard roasted malts, chocolate, bourbon, molasses, oak, coffee, ash, roast bitter finish. Fullbodied, creamy. Good stuff.
Bottle. Thanks to adnielsen for the bottle. Pours a black color with tan head. Bourbon, oak, roasty, chocolate aromas. Roasty, bourbon flavors.

Poured this from a 22 ounce bottle, thanks to Amy. Lots of burnt sugar notes, some raisin, plum, chocolate. Warming alcohol, creamy mouthfeel. I should mention this is batch one and it is a birthday gift to myself. Very nice. I will but more if given the chance. One of the best imperial stouts I have had.

Bottle 07.12.12
Visual: Pours black (dark dark red) with a small tan head. 
Aroma: Complex, Rye malt and some hops.
Taste: Chocolaty, coffee, mint, and is mildly spiced and vinous.

Bottle. Lots of barrel notes in aroma. Alcohol and milk chocolate. Taste is . Slightly woody. Big and smooth. Well balanced.


Visual:
Aroma:
Taste:

Bottle. Pours black with a latte coloured head. Lots of barrel notes in aroma. Alcohol and milk chocolate. Taste is very chocolaty, and has also got notes of coffee, mint, and is mildly spiced. Vinous. Slightly woody. Big and smooth. Well balanced.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2013 Midnight black pour.  Aroma of bourbon and a touch of vanilla.  Taste is smooth bourbon.  There is a bit of dark cherry in there.  Fairly thick consistency.  Very smooth.  This is very good stuff.  Not quite on the same level as Bourbon County, but very close.

650ml bottle. Pitch black colour with reawakening, average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, lasting, lacing, brown head. Complex dark malty aroma has notes of treacle, liquorice, vanilla, leather, wood, tobacco. Taste is initially sweet dark malty, treacle, liquorice, chocolate, honey, later the components combine to the taste of stracciatella ice, chocolate, vanilla, creamy palate; the sticky, lasting finish is governed by dry wood, leather and tobacco notes; a minimally biting touch of alcohol is present throughout. To quote my old friend Kolja: "Schmeckt gar nicht mal total Scheiße."

Bottle, thanks Hirigalzkar.
Pours heavy black with a brown head.
Smooth malty vanilla brew. The same sweet drinkability as all of the most sought after IS.

tulip. black cant see through body, tan medium head. Smell of vanilla, and caramels. medium to a high level of sweetness and the taste reflects the smell but it also has notes of chocolate, raisings and prunes. Love the fact that it has a medium level of carbonation and also a very smooth texture. the after taste leaves a oily chocolaty sensation. Brilliant!
Black color with a quickly falling medium head.  Strong bourbon aroma.  Rich chocolate and roasted malt flavor.  More very pronounced bourbon.  A bit of vanilla.  Full bodied.

On tap at Small Bars Stout night. I had this back to back with BCS Coffee, and the BCS won out. My rating might be higher if I try it again by itself.  Smells of bourbon, Vanilla, dark chocolate, anise.  Taste is a bit harsh for me.  It is a bit boozy, but Im also getting a slight amount of tartness in the palate, which is nice. Great beer

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2012 16.99 Bottle ordered from internet. Pours a velvety dark caramel with a sassy carbed head that takes any head forming down. Big complex aromas of chocolate, coffee, brown sugar, caramel, roasted malt, wood/oak, with just a hint of whiskey. Big mix of sweet chocolate/ cocoa, roasted malt, brown sugar, caramel, slight dark fruit, oak/wood, and light tobacco. Highly sweet for an Imperial Stout, medium bitter, and the alcohol comes through just a little bit through the nose but not to cloying with the other flavors but have to sip slowly. Did not notice any whiskey notes in the flavors which i abhor. This is made to be aged though with all that sweetness! Aged only for around 6 months after internet purchase.

Bottle [2012].
Pours black with beige head. High lacing. Aroma is of roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, sligth bourbon. Taste is of roasted malt, cream, bitterness. Warming alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Overall: Very good. Pretty complex.

Bottle (22 oz) 2011. Traded by jp7161, thanks Joseph! Pitch black with a small beige head and some lacing. Aroma is complex but smooth: bourbon, roasted malt, caramel and vanilla. Taste is more powerful with strong notes of bourbon (but not overwhelming), caramel, roasted malt, vanilla, chocolate and liquorice. Mouthfeel is creamy and theres an interesting warming alcohol presence. Great balance and wonderful complexity. A world-class bourbon barrel Imperial Stout.

2012 bottle, thanks to fredrik_!
Black with a light brown head.
Aroma: chocolate and coffee, liqueur and toffee.
Taste: lots of sweet licorice, chocolate liqueur, fruity, roasted, creamy.
Full bodied, smooth.
This is so well balanced and tasty! My taste buds were a bit worn out by now, so Im happy I have another bottle at home to just enjoy.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2012 Tap at APEX, Portland - 06/11/12. 
Mid black with a good tan head - looks the bollocks!
Nose of rich dark malts, wood, dark toffee, chocolate, almond/nutty tones, wood and a touch of bourbon/booze.
Tastes of chocolate, bourbon, treacle toffee, molasses, liqourice. Alcohol is very well hidden.
Full bodied with fine carbonation, smooth on the palate.
Had been looking out for this one for quite a while so pretty pleased to finally track it down and I wasnt disappointed!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Very black with beige head. Full aroma of chocolate and coffee, along with a big roasted character. Awesome. Flavor has chocolate exploding in youre face, bit has this caramel-like sweetness over it. Very nice balance here! This was great, it went perfect with my desert.

Pitch black liquid with a nice small mocha head. Little lacing some alcohol legs. Aroma is oak, sweet sugars, cherries, molasses, vanilla, raisins, chocolate. Very complex and balanced aroma. Taste; oak, vanilla, tannins, burnt, sweet dark fruits, raisins, a slight tart cherry note, some well hidden coffee and dark chocolate. Alcohol is present but doesnt disturb. To me this is a very balanced brew where the different flavours play a small part in a bigger complex flavour profile. Complex, smooth and a great BA Imperial Stout!
Bottle 2011. Pours jet black thin reddish head. Big chocolate and slight smoked aroma. Taste is big Booz chocolate
Bottle thanks to tomfoolery: Poured a deep black with a thin light brown head. Aroma is bourbon and chocolate. Taste is chocolate up front with lots of bourbon heat. Nice smooth sipper.

Bottle @ home .. From Trade with FullObs ... Thanks Brett ...it pours jet black with a small creamy light brown head.... The aroma is bourbon, roasted malt, caramel, chocolate and Dark fruits... The flavor is warming bourbon, roasted malt, coffee, dark chocolate, vanillia, licorice and dark fruits.... Very nice...

Pours very dark brown, almost black with creamy dark brown head. Very much chocolate in the aroma, also malts. One can also taste the alcohol which is why you better drink it slowly. I had it with a chocolate dessert, fits perfectly. Aftertaste is a little bitter.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2012 2012 bottle from trade with michaelinwa.  Thanks!  Pours a silky dark black color with a very little amount of beige head.  Good lacing on the glass.  Big tobacco and chocolate aroma along with some charred wood, marshmellow, vanilla, cherry, and bourbon.  Taste has a huge tobacco taste up front which mellows when the light bourbon flavor comes in.  Finish is a bit boozy with a hint of chocolate.  Full body with a very sticky and chewy mouthfeel.  This is a meal in a glass.  The bourbon becomes more pronounced as it warms.  Really well made beer and I can see how some people would love this beer.  I really like it but its not up there with my favorites.

Aroma: chocolate, roast malts, very nice bourbon notes, pleasant sweetness.  Pours jet black, nearly opaque, thin tan head.  Flavor: roast and coffee, dark chocolate, nice toffee sweetness, smooth barrel notes, alcohol is quite well hidden, enough bitterness to help balance but definitely malt focused.  Fairly full body, low-medium carbonation.  Really excellent brew!
Pours black with a small dark head. Aromas of oak and toasted coffee. Smooth, rich palate that starts with oak and vanilla and slowly shifts to coffee and caramel. The slightest hints of bourbon.

Thick and dark. Smells of oak, chocolate, bourbon, coffee, cherry. Strong taste, chocolate cherry syrup and a little coffee after. A lot going on, sip it slow. Enjoyed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pitch black.  Rich aroma of chocolate, dark malt, and roast.  Flavor is much of the same, with the barrel aging coming through and a nice whiskey flavor.  Whiskey warms at the finish.  Very smooth, very nice.  Wish this was more available.
Bottle. Oil black witha  thin tan head. Heavy chocolate and coffee mixed with smoked wood. Velvety texture, with vanilla and some warming whiskey in the finish

Insane chocolate caramel flavours, with great cool wood aged flavours.    Quality FW blending, balanance and grace.    Poured as a treat, and enjoyed slowly, contemplatively.   Kindof understated elegance.

22oz bottle from Armanettis. 2011 Vintage. Pours a black body with a finger-width, creamy, dark brown head that dissipates slowly and leaves lots of lacing throughout. Aroma is big, rich, smooth chocolates and caramels with a nice, roast and mocha backing. The bourbon and oak provides a solid addition without over-powering the big malt backing. Touches of vanilla, raisins, and a light alcohol hint. Flavor is similar. Rich, bittersweet dark chocolates up front with a good amount of roasts and caramel. The oak comes on with a lighter bourbon note as well as touches of vanilla, raisin, and licorice. Mocha, tobacco, and a bit more bourbon grows towards the end as this finishes rich, roasty, slightly ashy, and sweet with a nice bourbon warmth and dry oakiness. Lengthy aftertaste following a very smooth, mouth coating, full body and a soft, light carbonation. Overall, a very big, bold, rich, well balanced imperial stout with a solid barrel aged character. Not the most complex, but such a nice body and really enjoyable all-around. Great stuff.

Bottle dated 5/5/10 tasted 10/20/12 at near-to-room temperature

Dark, rich pour with a modest tan head. Cocoa, oak, and tobacco dominate the aroma which is excellent; beautiful, beautiful flavor surpasses it, gently bittersweet with chocolate, vanilla, baked apple skins, hops with backbone but never cutting to hard into the overall flavor. Warming mouthfeel, smooth with heavy viscosity. An excellent beer by any measure.

Bottle pours a dark brown close to black bit of a red in light. Tan head maybe a 1/4" that fades fairy fast. Not much carb. Tastes and smells of toffee chocolate booze small bit hops. Bourbon. Creamy small amount sweetness really good beer not over top nice mix that you come to expect from Firestone.

Bottle from a trade with cbkschubert. 2010 vintage. Pours dark brown/black color with light brown head. Aromas of bourbon, roasted malts, chocolate and some alcohol. Flavors of bourbon, bitter dark chocolate, dark roasted malts, vanilla, oak. Moderately boozy. Full body with minimal carbonation. A very nice barrel aged beer. Thanks Craig.

Big bottle kindly shared by Valeria at Galeria Kaufhof Berlin Alexanderplatz. Pitch black body with a short lived brown film. Inviting roasted notes, sweet liquorice and bourbon on the nose and in the mouth. Full bodied. Oily texture. Pungent beer.

From draft @ Burger. Rich and intense. Concentrated aromas and flavors of vanilla, toasted coconut, whiskey, chocolate syrup and everything dark. Smooth, thick, creamy mouthfeel, with lower carbonation. Definitely one to sip, or enjoy with chocolate desserts. Whiskey flavors dominate at first, then give way to more layered aromas and flavors as it warms. The alcohol is not shy, though seems appropriate given the flavors of whiskey are present. 

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Aroma is licorice, bourbon, molasses, alcohol.....and homemade apple pie.  You can just feel the weight of it as you pour the oil-like substance into a glass.  Small brown head that lines the glass throughout.  When I first smelled it, all I could do was hope that it tasted the same...and it does.  Only difference being a hint of hops up front before the tidal wave of complex dark flavors crushes them...followed by your taste buds.  One of the richest, most intense beers I've had...yet entirely drinkable.  Going back for more tomorrow.

2011 vintage. Batch 002. Poured from a bomber into my Founders snifter.

A: Pours a jet black. There is no way light could even dream of entering this chamber of emptiness. A 2 finger dark brown head shines on the pour with a great liveliness. Frothy and bubbly, the head leaves some nice sticky lace and has some legs to boot.

S: I pick up the bourbon right away with a the great oak barrel as well. Light vanilla with a light alcohol complimenting it as well.

T: Incredible flavor combination. I get the bourbon right upfront which smooths out to a great woody barrel barrel and light hoppiness. The finish consists of some sweet vanilla, light chocolate and a warming alcohol with a touch of heat. Just really hits all the notes.

M: Very smooth and incredibly warming down the throat. Heavy bodied with little carbonation, but just enough make it alive down your through.

O: I thought this was a great barrel-aged RIS. The flavors all meshed wonderfully and I wonder how good this could be with a little bit of age on it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-27-2011

Thx. to Jeff - bro - for this one. Sampled during RBBSG 2012. Black with a small mocha head. Smell is mellow toffee, which I wrote down like 3 times for some reason, brown sugar sweet with mocha, caramel and a sludge of bourbon, some head still coming off from this one. Taste is smooth creamy dark molasses, reasonable dark sugar, mocha, still some light bitter hops in the back, cocoa, bourbon sludge, it is rich stuff, lightly booze in the back - the good stuff, creamy bourbon-esque body - fine stuff - good swag

Aroma is strong of coffee, chocolate, cherries, tobacco, earthy notes and oak.  Appearance is lame, no head but dark oily texture so thats nice.  Taste is off the charts, almost thick like a syrup with a sweet after taste.  Palate is nice, nothing special.  Overall the best Firestone beer you can buy.

UPDATED: JAN 10, 2015 Bottled. A dark brown beer with a medium sized creamy beige head. Aroma is malty, notes of dark chocolate, coffee, alcohol and tons of wood. Taste is malty and sweet, notes of dark fruits, roasted malt, chocolate and wood. Winous texture. warming alcohol in the end. An amazing beer

Let me start off with one word. WOW. This is an amazing beer. It pours a rich black color with a small off-white head. The aroma is amazing. Whisky, malts, burnt chocolate, and tobacco. The taste is heaven. Its so good. Its not overly boozy or bitter. A perfectly balanced IRS if there ever was one. Im a huge fan of this brewery.

The aroma is a bit boozy but the taste changes as you go along. I like the after taste its complex....chocolatly, roasty, malty, figs n dark fruit. for an aroma and the abv I would expect it to be a little thicker. The taste and the aroma make up for the apperance. I like this beer alot. Probably my 3rd favorite behind Cigar Citys Marshal Zhukov & 3 Floyds Dark Lord:)

Bottle:  Dark brown pour with a finger of tan head.  Aroma is mostly the bourbon barrel with light bittersweetness and some roast.  Flavor is cocoa, roast, bittersweet, florals, and bourbon barrel.  Credit is due here to the overall amount and balance of the barrel aging.  Enough of the barrel aging is present, yet not overwhelming on the beer itself.

pitch black color, dark brown color. Dark chocolate, huge bourbon notes, carameltreacles. Uber smooth, rich full body, but never cloying or too sweet. Snoke hitting the back of the throat. Warming, rounded, bourbon smokey finish. Very full body, great depth. Really lovely.

Bottle shared by Jonno. Big bourbon barrel nose, vanilla, a bit of coffee, chocolate. Nice. Flavors of vanilla, chocolate, coca-cola, raisins, raspberries, lightly smoky and woody. Very smooth, a bit rough bitterness in the finish. Balanced and elegant use of bourbon barreli.e. not overdone.

At first I struggled with this on the nose, however as it warmed a huge JD bourbon nose hit me. Lots of Spent coffee grains and some rich, dark chocolate on the nose too. Sweet, but never cloying the bourbon is front and center here - but doesnt envelop the underlying beer. Chcolate brownies, a touch of smokey wood and even some raspberry in there. Finishes with some wood, smoke and dank hops. Hides 12.5% incredibly well. Really enjoyed this. There are better Impys around, but this is still a great example of the style.

Served in a tulip from a bottle. Pours jet black with a medium tan head that disapates completely. 

Light aroma of coffee and dark chocolate. 

Taste of vanilla, coffee, chocolate, charred oak, and dark fruit. 2012 was aged in bourbon, wine, and used FW beer barrels. The fruit flavors are likely imparted from the wine barrels. Simply delicious. 

Mouthfeel is soft and a little oily. Leaves a lasting finish that is wonderful. 

Dont think FW could make a bad beer if they tried.
Black with small tan head.  Sweet aroma with dark fruits.  Taste is sweet and malty, bit of dark fruit, some bourbon.  Body is smooth and good.  Nice beer.
Drink this beer with a chunk of 72-80% dark chocolate. You will not be disappointed.

Jet black colour, no head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, roasted malts, mocca, caramel and bourbon. Rather sweet flavour, coffee and milk, dark chocolate, caramel, vanilla and wood. Finish quite alcoholic, coffee, milk chocolate and bitter hops.
(From 65cL bottle @ RBBSG II, Wilrijk. Reserve series 003. Courtesy of beerdrifter. Thanks Jeff!)
Smoky, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, oak. Nose is a bit sweet and bourbon. Pours dark, not too thick, with tan head. I would drink this all the time if I could!!

UPDATED: MAY 8, 2013 22oz bottle, shared with my wife.  What more can be said about this, that hasnt already been said?  Nice aromas and flavors of bourbon, chocolate and oak.  A bit hot, probably since we drank a 12.  Awesome beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11/VIII/2012 bomber bottle @ RBBSG - BB: n/a (2012-916) Thanks to Jeff (Beerdrifter) for sharing the bottle!
Clear very dark brown beer, no head. Aroma: mocha, caramel, dark chocolate, bit alcoholic, sweet sugary. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: quite sugary, sweet malts, honey, very noticeable hop touch, dark chocolate and cocoa powder. Aftertaste: sweet caramel, bitter hops, cocoa powder, lots of dark chocolate, some alcohol.
Aroma of vanilla, butterscotch, bourbon, and wood.  Pours black and viscous with brown head.  Taste is caramel, coffee, vanilla, toffee and oak.  Delicious.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2014 Brief re-re-review of the 2014 vintage. Now, I can safely say, Parabola finally lives up to the hype. All the best qualities of the 13 vintage (the depth, the richness, the bourbon character) was here in full force, but - despite being 14% - it wasnt that harsh. The oak was prevalent, but the fusel-y abrasiveness of the 13 was almost perfectly muted this time around.
